But I could see that it is very popular with families, adults, young people and children; who have fun in the pool and bar area at any time of day until 10 pm, after that time the place is quiet to rest and get up early. The transportation service to the university and nearby places of the hotel is free and almost personalized; I recommend it strongly because my stay together with my 17 year old son was very pleasant in a safe, friendly and welcoming environment.

Our team was booked into this hotel as a group. The hotel was supposed to supply breakfast and dinner, but the food was so bad, we ended up getting Olive Garden take out for the team every night. The room was damp and musty and the furniture was circa 1960. The athletes needed to sleep at night, and there were multiple loud parties going on. Do yourself a favor and stay elsewhere.

Dirty, outdated, no fridge, expensive parking. They had a party/reunion blasting music until midnight when we needed a good night sleep. Hundreds of calls to the front desk yielded moronic responses and no refund. Don‚Äôt stay here.

This is my second time staying here.  This is my place when I come to Orange County.  It's very convenient, right next to the airport, and it's quiet and I feel at home too.  There is a restaurant and a convenient store next to the hotel and so you can get what you need at anytime.

Actually I extended my stay at this hotel for 2 additional nights. This is great value for what you get- quiet rooms, big tv -everything exceeded expectations. I am retired and travel extensively- stay in 40-50 hotels each year- this one ranks amongst the best!

Summary Heading: As usual a good place to stay.
Summary: I say here frequently, I like its low key nature. The pool area is a good hang when to bar is open. dining by the pool is relaxing.   One of the nice features of this hotel, the food service does not feel like a ripoff.   The staff is friendly.

Who has popcorn ceilings? This hotel is old and very run down.  Hall carpets are in need of a good cleaning.  The stench in the hall is horrible.  No USB plugs or outlets near the beds.  Wall paper peeling.  The duvets and shams look old and should be replaced.  The pool and lobby look modern and updated but that's where it stops.  No mini fridge or any little extras in your room.  Air condition very old and loud.  The walk from you car to your room is at your risk.  The walk way and path is very uneven and in need of repair just to be able to roll your luggage thru.  Beds were very lumpy and pillows were old and had lost their shape.  Miserable 2 nights there.  Will not return ever.

Summary Heading: IF AC is important - Look Elsewhere !
Summary: Website looks nice.  We stayed in room 224 on 19 July 2017.  Room was dirty, dusty, and had an odor.  Carpet was dirty and stained.  Vents in room had large amounts of dust accumulation.  When we got to room the AC thermostat was already set on lowest setting but room was not cool.  Temp in room was 79.  We called and a service tech came in and monkeyed around some with thermostat.  He couldn't speak much English but said it was "fixed", however the air coming out of the vents never got cool.  It was a Long night.    Location is great for early flights at JWA so one star for that only.  I wont be staying again.  There is a Hilton next door, bit more cost but worth it if you desire working AC to sleep well.  Do yourself a favor and just find another room elsewhere.

The rare U.S. hotel that is literally walking distance from the airport. You routinely see pilots and flight attendants wheeling their roller bags across MacArthur Blvd to this hotel. The hotel itself is not in the best shape, but it's adequate. Restaurant hours are limited.   Parking is extra, though you may not need a car if you're just catching a night before or after a flight.

The entrance looked great and the valet was good at first.  The rooms are old and have nasty musty smells.  This hotel needs to be renovated thus the reason the rates are so cheap for Orange County.  When i went to get car from valet they are not there had to go to front desk many times for my car.   I would not recommend unless you want cheap.  The old adage you get what you say for.....

AC doesn't work. No room amenities. Can't use the electrical outlets, they're so loose the chargers fall out. NEVER stay here.

The style and feel of the hotel is very welcoming. Only complaint was the wait for the hotel shuttle was long, but had I known just how close  the hotel was to the airport we could have walked!! It's literally across the street, amazing location for easy airport access. Overall very pleased with with our stay.

Like other reviews have said, the hotel has seen its better days and could use a major renovation, but for the price of just below $100 per night, and next the O.C. airport and freeway, it is a safe and decent hotel. Both valet and self parking are available for a fee.

Summary Heading: I wish there was a "Good" rating...has a lot of pros and some basic cons.
Summary: First the goods: Location is a simple walk from airport (as long as you are not dressed in a heavy suit and it is 90 degrees out) or they have a complimentary shuttle, it has a very nice lobby to meet with colleagues, it is within walking distance of Gulliver's which is an excellent restaurant, the pool area is great for a tranquil rest or cozy meeting with cabanas available and the meeting rooms being near the pool/open air area is a plus.  The drawbacks:  It is dated and in need of some basic TLC.  The walkways near the pool have some not-well-filled cracks, the outside color of the ENTIRE hotel is just awful. The staff take good care of the rooms but the hallways need a refresh.  It has so much more potential.

Summary Heading: Good Value for a budget hotel with airport convenience...
Summary: Hotels can be pricey in Irvine (upwards of $150 plus) so this Hotel with its location immediately across from SNA allows for simple savings and convenience especially for an early/late flight. Rooms are a bit tired but for the sub$100 range, you can't go wrong. You wouldn't stay here for a week, but it makes do. Also has nice Pool/Cabana area and conference rooms. This hotel is becoming run down. The room was clean, but the common areas smelled. The general feeling of hallways and rooms was a run down property that hasn't been keeping up  With maintenance .   I would not return.

I have rated the property as excellent given the star rating. (Read this as it is not a 5 diamond resort so don't expect that or you will be disappointed.)   The staff were great.  The catering was great- I heard a lot of positive feedback about the food from others as well.    If you are looking for a place to host an event, I think you will be happy here. The breakfast was poor (but at least present), no place to get food or a drink after 9pm, really awkward organisation of the rooms without clear signs as to which room is where (and what they circled on the map was clearly wrong and I was sent very much the non-optimal way to my room). Parking was a mess with many people waiting a while to find a parking spot. To

Summary Heading: Hard to match location and service
Summary: There are fancier places nearby, but as a total experience, Atrium has so much going for it, at affordable prices, and with so much charm exuding from the staff, it would be hard to match--especially since it is directly across from John Wayne Airport with a free shuttle available or for a 5 minute walk.  Frederick Pina, Jr., Front Office Manager directs his staff with almost flawless perfection, from the welcome to guest services, and even to special requests--which we won't divulge here.  Lisa is cordial by phone and in person, and perfectly invites guests into the Atrium home away from home. She is a hostess/front desk staff with more than a winning smile and a friendly hello. She cares. She acts on requests. There is no push back even with a concern.  When we had booked our

Based on some of the reviews, I was hesitant to stay here.  It may be a bit dated in the bathrooms but the room was much larger than most hotel rooms.  The Atrium's rooms have a balcony with a large slider. I love getting fresh air in hotel rooms.  I thought the room was great and the price made it a bargain.  The pool area and lobby are lovely.

Had a one day trip to Orange County and the Atrium hotel fit the bill perfectly.  Its a 5 minute walk from John Wayne Airport - how good is that!.  Check in/out was easy and efficient.  Room was clean and quiet. Great pool area!

I had a 1 day layover here..and The Atrium was closest by, walking distance about 4 blocks.  Online info said rooms were $79 per night but desk charged me $99, but not a real problem I know off site Web sites can be wrong.  Staff and accommodations were very nice.. room just a bit dated, small but clean. The nicest area seemed to be around the pool, which was surrounded with plush cabanas.  The buffet breakfast in the restaurant in the morning apparently is included with some rooms but I wasn't on the list so had to pay..

Summary Heading: Sylvia could care less if you have any concerns at all!!!!!
Summary: Bugs in room , damp, free internet doesn't work, room out of date, no room service.....etc.  agree with other reviewers that after you get past the front door and pool area at night, there is nothing desirable about this hotel except the shuttle drivers and bartenders. If you didn't have to actually split to anyone at front desk to access services I may have rated it only 1/2 star higher.

Online this place looks rather nice. When we arrived it was less than stellar. It looked like there was a lot of emphasis placed on the facade, which was lovely with foliage and waterfalls, but once past the lobby, it was far from that. The hallways looked worn, and my son said it looked like something from Hotel Tower of Terror. The management allowed raucous behavior by other guests out by the pool until wee hours of the morning. There was even a fight the second night of our stay. With that being said, the beds were comfortable. Speaking of beds, if you desire a roll away, you won't be given one unless you are in a room with only a king size bed. My daughter needed to have her own bed because she received a blow to the head earlier in the day, and had a concussion. She needed

Summary Heading: The only good thing in this hotel, is the door, on your way out...
Summary: The only good thing in this hotel, is the door, on your way out... Room was at the far end of the hotel, with a "nice" view of the parking lot and everyone that passes by see all that is going up in the room.  Breakfast buffet is mostly greasy items. Staff were the worst that can be... I have asked to borrow scissors to pack many items in my room.  Was told that I have to do it in the lobby, since it is the policy not to give it to the rooms. Do they afraid that I stub someone...?  in my room I can stub only 1-2 persons, in the lobby, I can stub many... so I do not really know the reason for that. I have stayed in hundreds of hotels around the world, never seen anything like that.  Basically, a third world service. I had to bring all my 4 big bags to the lobby, opened everything

We stayed at this hotel over Labor Day weekend.  While an older property, the rooms had fresh paint and furnishings.  The problem was the restaurant. The buffet Breakfast on Sunday was good with curteous staff, but the issues were Monday morning.  When we went to get some breakfast, the restaurant was chaos.  Every table that was unoccupied had dirty dishes and trash upon it.  There was nobody to be found to remedy this situation, even when we asked at the desk.  Finally one person showed up but they were unable to keep up with the workload.  This went on for hours! We left, had our meal somewhere else and when we returned the tables were still full of dirty dishes. No explanation was offered from the desk.

Our visit was miserable from start to finish. We pulled up out front to check in and a rude valet attendant said I needed to move if I wasn't going to use his valet service. I explained that I simply wanted to check in first. He rolled his eyes and told me to move my car to the other side. No other cars around at the time. After a long wait at the front desk, I had to endure the condescending tone of the front desk attendant.  The hallways are dirty, the elevators hot. Our room was dated and dirty. Not comfortable on any level.  The breakfast buffet was a complete disaster. I walked in to find all but two tables covered in dirty dishes. The people brave enough to eat there were wandering around looking for plates and utensils. No servers to be found. I didn't dare eat anything

Summary Heading: Hotel with Enterprise Rental Car on-site
Summary: We rented a car from this location to avoid airport fee. Since this location is off SNA airport, they currently offer $9.99 weekend rental rate.  You can walk to this Hotel (just across the street from the airport) or Hotel offers complimentary shuttle service around the airport.   Also, free Wi-Fi service is available throughout the entire hotel to keep you connected.

A comfortable place to spend the night. This hotel is right across the street from SNA airport. A few restaurants are within walking distance and nice breakfast is available at the hotel. Rooms are comfortable but not modern looking. We booked the combo package with room+parking+breakfast for a great deal.

We had planned to stay at this hotel for a few nights. The first night the room we had was the "standard" room. It smelled strange, had popcorn ceilings, and the carpet was damp. The room was very dark and in serious need of updates. In the morning we complained and they agreed to give us an "upgrade". This room was not quite as dark but still very outdated. I went to the "business center" in the evening and couldn't figure out how to use the printer because it was was so old. The walk through the dark, dingy hotel was creepy. My children felt uncomfortable. We did not use the pool but it did look nice.

I stayed only one night but the lobby and the pool area are very nice.  I did use the "gym" it's a tiny room behind the pool but it did the job.  The restaurant was under construction so they were serving at the pool, food was good and a touch on the expensive side. Burger, Fries & glass of wine $24.00.  They have great lounge seating and summer evening was great weather. Staff very nice and friendly.  The room was very average but good bed and clean with a nice patio with a slider, however they didn't have a chair out on the patio which i thought was weird. Location great to airport and freeway.

Beautiful hotel, very nice poolside, friendly staff but mediocre service. Possible understaffed.  Provide room service that you must pick up yourself for lack of delivery staff. Our TV spontaneously turns black an is frozen. It came back on in evening but would not in am. When calling front desk, room phone will not connect, had to call from my cell. Could also hear very loud argument from nearby room lasting over 10 minutes, nearly called for security or 911 due to escalation.

I was traveling alone as a single woman and was not comfortable. The rooms did not feel or appear (hair in the bathroom, etc.) clean. To further my point, I was not walking around the room without shoes. To get from the parking lot to the lobby area, there was only one entrance which was not ideal late at night. The ac in my room had an odor. Spend the extra money and get something more updated. A plus - very NICE staff. All very helpful and kind.

We stayed Monday through Saturday. Even though it's literally right across the street from the John Wayne Airport, I never heard or saw the plane traffic. We needed more towels and a stack of towels came within 15 minutes. The bathtub was old, but surprisingly the shower was great! The pool area/bar is spectacular! Tropical setting with curtained-off outdoor "living rooms" around the sides of the pool area for your family/guests. The only downside of this great setting is they allow smoking. Beds were very comfortable, staff very friendly and helpful, and it's a great location for going to Disneyland. It also has a washer and dryer.  We did not have a fridge or microwave, but that might be an offering in other rooms. Wifi worked great for all four of us--two teenagers were using

Summary Heading: I love this place for local romantic "stay-cations"
Summary: This is a favorite place of my girlfriend, and I. She lives in LA, and I live in San Diego, and we like to meet here for little romantic rendezvous.   The hotel is comically dated. It looks like a time capsule from the 70s/80s, but it's not bad. The rooms and bathrooms are clean and fresh, you can just tell that the place is getting old. I think it's well worth the price especially if you book with a Gov't, Military, or AAA discount.   The pool area is cool. We have been there a couple of times when the pool area has been rented out for parties or weddings. That's a little annoying, because if there is an event, the pool area cannot be used by other guests.  The hotel offers several amenities; a spa, a gift shop, 2 bars, and a restaurant. The sunset bar is very cool, when it's

Check in was easy after being all day in disneyland. The room we got smelled really bad like moldy old, carpet was old, outdated room. The front view of the hotel looks amazing as well as the pool but I did not like the room we stayed in. The air conditioning was not working it was pretty hot.

Flight diverted with layover in Orange County. Hotel is across the street from the airport with 24 hr. Free shuttle service to and from the airport.  Very convenient, affordable, and comfortable.  Sorry I couldn't stay longer.  Nice ambience. Gas station next door has snacks and drinks available and there is an IHOP a couple of blocks away. Hotel has a dining area but I arrived too late to check it out.

Summary Heading: Airport Hotel with Car Rental facility/Old property not upgraded
Summary: The hotel staff was not at all greeting, i reached before three and i was told to come back after half an hour since the rooms are not ready. This has never happened to me before.The hotel has a nice pool bar but was slow and closes at 11.The rooms were old fashioned and not updated. The doors and windows are not much updated either. You basically pay for staying across the airport if you have to. There is not much to do around the hotel area so you have to drive.

Summary Heading: Cant say enough about friendly staff
Summary: I travel for work and have stayed in a variety of Hotels. This hotel far exceeded my expectations. The wait staff from the check-in front desk to the restaurant to the pool side bar - they all just made you felt like home! The restaurant had the appearance of a typical restaurant. I was very pleased to find that the food and service was that of fine dining at a very reasonable price. Bartolo was my waiter for two nights in a row (yes, I went back), and you would think he was trained to be a server at the four seasons in New York! Then Tasha, at the pool side bar was MORE than accommodation to so many of the clientele. The amenities on this property honestly exceed what the website conveys! Anytime I am in this area, I WILL STAY HERE!

The good: clean rooms, helpful staff.  Pool area in center is pleasant.  WiFi worked reasonably well.  Surprisingly quiet, given location on a major street and across the street from the airport.  The bad: Decor hasn't been renovated since the disco era - there's one conference room above the front entrance that looks like it's frozen in the 1970s.  Many of the other rooms have similar dated decor.  Mixed: The location is great if you're going to/from the airport, and inconvenient for anything else.  Within walking distance there's an IHOP and nothing else to eat.  There's a Starbucks that isn't too far away, but given the light timings, it takes 10 minutes to walk there.  Anything else requires driving.

Summary Heading: It was Fri evening and the nightclub was not open....
Summary: The front staff were very nice, the room was right by the pool.... which was also very inviting.  The restaurant staff were very welcoming and able to answer my questions about what was around for me to do.  My soup was tasty and another lady was raving about the chicken dinner she had enjoyed the evening before.   Really liked the pool bar and the bartender but..... nothing was going on in the nightclub or around the pool.  No more dancing there!  That was my only disappointment.  If I had had kids with me they would have loved the pool area.

Pictures on the website were very nice.  The lobby was pretty but the rooms, corridors were old, dingy and small bathrooms. Furniture was old and the hallways smelled.  It was very disappointing, especially after seeing the pics.

I used to stay at the Atrium regularly 10+  years ago when I traveled frequently to CA. I was pleased to see that it is still there when I was back in CA last week. This was the first hotel at John Wayne airport that is directly across the street and just a 10 minute drive to Newport Beach and local Irvine businesses.  The hotel is not shiny and new but it is clean, the rooms are fine and up to date and it has character. It also has a nice pool area in the courtyard with a bar and it has a decent restaurant. The staff is super friendly and helpful too. I would say that it has the rooms of a Hampton Inn, the amenities of a Doubletree and a lot more rustic charm. I also got my rooms for 1/2 the price of the Hilton next door.  I highly recommend it.

This is likely the worst hotel I have ever stayed at.  Despite the fact that the hotel is literally across the street from the airport (although there are no sidewalks), it took 1/2 hour for the shuttle bus to make the promised 10 minute arrival time.  The hotel is old and date...and had a funky smell.  The bathroom just didn't feel clean and had a dog-wash sized tub.  The meeting rooms had the same weird smell and the carpet in the hallway was gross.  We checked out after one night and moved hotels.

This is (I think) an independently owned hotel located literally immediately across the street (within easy walking distance) from John Wayne Airport (SNA - Orange County). It is by no means a fancy place, but it has a charming atmosphere and very helpful and friendly staff. It is arranged around an open air bar and pool with cabanas, which is a very nice place to have a drink with friends. The rooms are quiet (at least mine was when I was there) and fairly large. I have no doubt that this particular hotel offers great value and will certainly stay there again on my next visit to Irvine.

Summary Heading: Atrium Hotel, Good Value and Conveniently Located at John Wayne Airport
Summary: Attending a last minute conference, I managed to book a room at the Atrium Hotel across from the John Wayne Airport. An easy walk across the street from the airport (walking through the airport garage to MacArthur), I found the hotel clean, albeit a bit dated in d√©cor. I noted they were remodeling the center courtyard pool area and it looked refreshing and inviting...only wish I had enough time to hang-out with a margarita! My room was very clean and reasonably quiet on the second floor in the back, except I did note there was construction outside my room window, but I left early in the morning so, I heard nothing... It appears they share their parking lot with Enterprise Car Rental drop-off, but parking is not an issue. I would stay here again...

Disappointed with staff. I've been coming to this hotel for business for over ten years. Morning staff seemed to go out of their way to find obstacle  rather than solutions. I go to quite a few hotels and usually find staff trying to find ways to solve the inevitable challenges when setting up workshop- these guys seemed like they couldn't care less.

Summary Heading: Excellent service and housekeeping, few amenities
Summary: My room was pleasant, quiet, and clean, and I found the front desk staff most helpful.  I agree that some parts of the hotel are drab (corridors and stucco especially).  From my point of view, the weakness of the hotel was the restaurant--discontinued room service and breakfast buffet with few options, although I discovered that I could ask for a plate of whole wheat toast.  Seems to me that a hotel next to an airport should have room service.

My review is mostly a decent one.  First of all Maria at the front desk was so helpful in getting me into the perfect room for my two week stay.  I would say if you are in the "right" room and that is away from construction, the parking lot and the airport, you could actually enjoy a mostly peaceful environment. My gripe comes from my return from the grocery store to find that my room key didn't work.  It was a long walk to reception and so I decided to leave all the groceries at my door.  I was very upset to find out that the reason my key didn't work was because they wanted me to pay my bill for the week!  No phone call, no reminder under the door.  Let's just lock her out and force a visit!  This was especially frustrating to me because I'm used to paying at the END of my

Summary Heading: Great Service, But the place could use some updates!
Summary: When you first walk into the Atrium, you will probably thinking you have arrived at a pretty posh hotel.  The waterfall and over all ambiance of the Lobby are very nice.  But, that is probably as good as it gets.  Many of the rooms and hallways are dated with old, stained carpet and the rooms were on the smaller side.  We did however receive great service from the hotel staff and were even allowed to change rooms when we discovered the room was much smaller than we were expecting and not suited to our needs.  The internet was wi-fi and of average speed.  We had a fridge in the larger room we got, as it was a suite but the regular rooms do not.  Overall I feel like this hotel is lacking a lot of the amenities of many newer hotels, but I'd say the staff service makes up for a lot

9 out of 10 as one employee at the front desk refused to help me. Everyone else was fabulous, especially Maria at the front desk as well as the concierge who took me to the University this afternoon (he just started). Hotel staff make all the difference!

The hotel in very convenient to the John Wayne Airport and close to many restaurants and services. The hotel is clean and nice, a little tired but not too bad.  The cost is reasonable, the pool and area is attractive. Free internet and a comfortable room

Summary Heading: Good choice for john wayne airport
Summary: Spacious clean and quiet room. Competent and friendly staff. Airport shuttle right on time, something I value greatly. Good internet. A trifle tired, but so is my living room at home. Would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Crappy Motel Dressed Up Like It's High End
Summary: They've done small minor improvements like nice outdoor furniture, a pool and lobby decoration which makes it feel like a really high-end place. That is good enough to land a booking by people booking online who haven't visited. I had a pretty miserable stay. The room smelled dank, the water from the taps taste metallic, the walls were paper thin (could hear my neighbor's bowel movements, brushing teeth etc.), their gym (just a converted room) is open only from 8am-11pm which makes it unusable for business travelers, and their restaurant stops serving food fairly early too. All in all go for it if you're on a budget or get a screamer of a deal. But don't expect luxury living like the pictures promise you.

Pros: Bedding was nice, look of the room itself was good. Cons: Building smelled a bit, bathroom was tiny and cheap, cockroach on the floor in the am, noisy building, cheap/thin towels, many outlets in the room did not work, carpet 100 years old... The pool/bar looked nice, the cabanas are a nice touch.  The front staff were nice enough on check in.  That said, there is pretty much no way I am going back...

We drove for 7 hours and came to hotel late around 9 pm very tired . We meet not friendly check in manager , she did not want to help as with any breakfasts/ parking package. We need to leave for our sons games at 7am next morning and need it to figure out his breakfast before first game ... I was frustrated, I did not believe I am in CA !     When we came to the room I had more shock about the maintains of the room - it was so smelly ..... We need to sleep with open doors . They have the old popcorn sealing ( we in CA) and more you can see on my pic. Check out the year of expiration we found it in elevator . It's just sad to pay the price of the hotel and stay in very low laval of motel.

Price is right (especially if you are connected in any way to an event at UCI.), A shuttle runs anywhere within 3-miles (call when you need to get back). The UCI shuttle (uber cool Hydrogen fuel-cell electric bus) makes circuit of local hotels and UCI.  I found 8 museums within 3-miles of the hotel. One was within walking, and the others the hotel shuttle would take you to them.  The room was clean, and when I asked for an extra blanket-- I got two.  The breakfast buffet in the morning is limited.... but ask. Scrambled eggs, tons of beacon, and fruit. I asked for toast. there was cereal and yogurt out as well.   The front desk staff is friendly and are eager to help you get around. Looking forward to my next visit.

Summary Heading: Use to stay at the Crowne Plaza - Moved here for price and ammenities.
Summary: The Crown Plaza  raised their rates and the wait-staff in the restaurant advised me NOT to eat there.  Should have listened.  Went looking for a new hotel and ended up here.  Not as swanky but a LOT better kept and bigger rooms.  The restaurant is AMAZING.  I mean seriously Amazing!  I had trout one night that was in a shrimp and butter sauce.  The burger is ground angus beef.  The carrot cake is made in house with Italian cream cheese.  The staff is great and the parking is cheaper too!

Great staff from moment we arrived until the time we left.  Older hotel but maintained excellent  Breakfast was great and again staff was wonderful.  Across the street from SNA was a added bonus for morning flight  out.  Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Decent Hotel - Slightly Dated but Trying to be Cool - at a Very Convenient Airport Location
Summary: An older hotel that is literally within 5 minutes walking distance of the Orange Country Airport albeit they offer a shuttle.  The rooms are a bit dated but the Hotel is trying hard to have that LA / SOCAL "Cool" look with a pool bar with small cabanas with TVs, LED  lighted trees  and that SOCAL trendy background music. A good choice at a reasonable price if you want to stay near the airport.  Although there is a restaurant onsite there is a iHop, Steak House and an El Tortitos a block or so away by sidewalk.

I wanted a place close to the airport for the night. This place has a nice lobby and pool, after that I cannot say much nice.  I had to visit the front desk three times as my key would not open my room. I did not want to play this game all day and requested a different room.  It's old, outdated and smells.  This place has the quality of a motel 6 with the prices of something where you expect much more.

The room is nice, I guess, it's definitely spacious, a little dated. Everywhere I go, no matter what I travel with a pack of clorox disenfectant wipes. I wipe down every remote, light switch, phone, toilet seats, door knobs, peep hole, etc., in every hotel room I stay in and when I did with this one, the "White wipe hopefully is still white ratio", from how dirty the wipe was 1-10 w/ 10 being the dirtiest, it was about a 6. I wipe down my own night stands where the lamps and the dated phone is and the wipe was YELLOW after I was done. Bathroom is kind of gross. GREEN Calcium build up on the faucets, the tile in the bathroom was very dirty and yellow, the phones had wax in the hearing end, the interior of the room is so bizarre and it doesn't match anything.I Don't know what

We stayed at the Atrium for 6 nights as it was close to proximity of family in Tustin. Very close to Newport Beach, South Coast plaza and Fashion Island shopping malls both of which are great to visit. Accomodation was very good bed was great pool was great and teh Caban's are great. Will return

I spent a couple of days and had several inconveniences. The first was parking, on arrival I chose the valet parking at $14.00 per day, I went out later that afternoon and had to wait 15 minutes for my car, not that they were busy, there was just no one around apparently the valet is also the shuttle driver. So I switched from valet to self parking at $12.00 per day, I came back late on a Saturday night and the parking lot was totally full I had to drive around to find a spot, which was complicated by the fact that the parking lot was full of intoxicated people, apparently they not only allow long term parking from airport across street but obviously local drinking places as well. O Sunday I went to my room and key did not work so back to lobby and back to room, key still not

This is an interesting place with a hotel bar that that can be fun at times. The Bar draws a good locals group of older people who like to dance. The rooms were quiet and decorated different from your normal run of the mill hotels. This is not a Marriott.... and that's why I like to stay here.They have lots of parking and its super convenient to the Airport across the street. Newport Beach is just down the hill. Very friendly staff and a good three meal restaurant. Also very convenient to the Freeway.

My friends and I stayed here to attend a concert at Irvine meadows amphitheater. This place was nice and affordable. It's across the street from the airport a quick cab ride to the concert and close to the irvine spectrum. The rooms were large and clean and bright. Defiantly would stay here again.

I stay here every time I visit OC, It is an older hotel and not like the 5 star hotels I generally stay in, but I always come back because the rates are amazing for the area, they have a wonderful pool and the staff is courteous. We needed extra towels and a new remote control they were up in less than 15 minutes, the waiter in waterfalls is so nice and totally on point, the bartenders at the pool are fun and friendly - staff at front desk is as well. The airport is across the street and the beaches are 15-12 minutes away - I am kind of a hotel snob and this is one I will continue to visit even though its older and not as pretty , the beds are so comfortable as well.

Summary Heading: I'm surprised they are still in buisness
Summary: This hotel could be a commercial for false advertising. We booked the room for our soccer team because it was recommended by the tournament. The only way this could be possible is if they got money for the endorsement. Where to start. The hotel looked beautiful from outside and the lobby was very nice but check in was very slow yet when it was my turn she handed me a bunch of papers and said sign these. I asked what they were and she said "team rules you don't need to read it just sign here" seriously?! We had booked our rooms together so we could be close. When I asked if we were next to our team she said "yes you are all on the first floor" turns out all on the first floor but different wings. We couldn't get further away from each other. The pool was nice but as others

Summary Heading: Wonderful stay and evening - reunion get together. Careful of wet conditons around pool.
Summary: We had a wonderful time for our 35th high school class reunion. We reserved a large cabana at the pool and got together for lots of conversations, eats, drinks and fun times. We held our 30th reunion here in 2010 in the large meeting room. The accommodations are very comfortable, the location is convenient, the people are very nice, and we always have a relaxing time.  We incurred a few problems where if they resolve them would make both stays perfect - service for ordering and delivering food is slow. The food is very good and yummy but again slow. The evening was busy with our group, several other groups outdoors around the pool, and another reunion in the large banquet room. At the bar there were 2 bartenders but the drinks were slow coming too.  The next morning at the

First impressions when I walked in was it had a nice lobby, front desk was nice checking me in. They give me my key and I ask how to get to my room. He pulls out a business card sized map and draws a line with one turn and says there is your room. So I say or great, so my gf and myself grab our luggage and start looking for our room. After walking around for literally like a half hour in an insanely hot hotel with no clear signage as to where anything is at. I finally find it. The room-ot was decent sized, definitely not what they show what it is in the pictures online. The bathroom was small and gross. The bed wasn't bad, but that's it. Now we came to attend a HS reunion. Which was held in their outdoor pool area and we also had an adjacent small banquet room. The facilities

The ceramic tile around the pool provides a major hazard for everyone when wet. I watched many children and adults fall and get injured during my stay. There is not enough drains on the pool deck so as a result large pools of water surface on the deck and present a major hazard for everyone.   Just be aware. You are at your own risk!!!

We loved the location of this hotel. It was beyond convenient and easy to get to from the airport since it's directly across the street. We were close to the interstates 405 and 5 which was great. The hotel was old/outdated but very clean. Check in was super easy. They put a $50 hold per night per room on your CC and self parking was $12 a night. Gas station is right next to hotel so filling up the rental car was easy. They provide you with the password to the wifi.

This one is a difficult one to rate.   We were here for a soccer tournament, and this was the hotel that the team selected. It is located directly across the street from John Wayne Airport. I was hesitant at first because I didn't want to hear airplane noise all night, but I did not. Rooms are very quiet.   Checking in was a unique experience. I've never signed and initialed more places that I have here. It was crazy.  A step back into the past occurs when entering into a popcorn-ceiling, retro wall-papered room. Rooms are rather dated, but I found that the beds were very comfortable and the rooms are clean. There are no microwave or refrigerators.   Hairdryer did not work, ironing board was bent, bathtub (i'm not sure if that's what you call it) very slow to drain. The bathtub

The location is directly across a busy road from SNA airport. You could walk if you wanted to get the cramped muscles moving after a long flight. The area is mainly hotels and business parks. This property is located directly between two larger hotel chains.  This property is a good budget option. I will agree with most of the reviews.   We checked in well past 11pm due to a flight delay then a mixup at car rental. The desk agent was cordial but definitely did not go out of her way to make a travel weary guest feel welcomed. We were given a room at the very back of the property. Required to drive through a gate and enter through a back door. Maybe occupied by 25 cars on a Tuesday night.   Yes the ceilings have the popcorn finish but that didn't compare to the "uniqueness" of the

We had a whole day meeting at this hotel with our lunch served at the Pool Cabana.  The staff was very friendly and helpful, making sure we get all we need to start our meeting right. Enrica (I am sorry if I spell the name wrong) came to us from time to time and check on us if we need anything.   We had our lunch at the pool cabana, what a great way to break from the busy morning meeting agenda. They have a pool side bar serving refreshments and lunch menu make to order.   I will recommend this place to anyone needing a meeting space.

We were forced to stay here as part of a team commitment for a tournament in Irvine. The hallways are low, dark, and need a coat of paint. There are no microwaves or refrigerators, which are a necessity for traveling athletes that have to be on the field during regular dining hours. Once we were in our room, the dead bolt didn't work due to poor installation. The desk was informed, but it wasn't until our return from the day's activities and a second call that it was taken care of by maintenance. The room is clean, but it too needs the popcorn ceiling removed and water spots painted. The bathroom has the smallest tub/shower combo I have ever seen. It is a 3x3 square! There is no way any adult could ever take a bath sitting down. Too add insult to injury, they charge a ridiculous

I love this hotel!  This was the 2nd time I stayed here, and the front desk is so courteous.  I told them I was coming (again) for an event, and could they put me in a room on the 2nd floor, close to the Ballroom.  When I arrived they had a great room set aside for me, but I had arrived too early at 12:15 &  it wasn't ready.  My 4th of July plans weren't for 2 1/2 more hours, so I sat by the pool in one of their beautiful cabanas, relaxed and had a great lunch (love the food!).  Then at 2:30 when I went back to the desk they had my room ready.  They include free breakfast for two, so I took advantage of that before I went home on Sunday.    The pool area is spectacular and so is the lobby.  I will definitely come back again.

I stayed at the Atrium recently for work (since it was where my other colleagues were staying), but wish I had stayed elsewhere.  The one major pro this place has is the great pool area and outdoor bar (where I actually had a meeting one of the days I was there).  A very relaxed atmosphere, which was great.  Additionally, the king-sized bed in my room was amazingly comfortable.  However, that's pretty much where the pros end.  The bathroom was, as another reviewer put it, postage-stamp sized.  The bathroom also looked like it hadn't been thoroughly cleaned after the previous guest had left -- there was a used bar of soap in the soap tray in the shower, and there was hair in the drain that washed back up into the tub when I turned the water on to take a shower.    The WiFi wasn't

Has good customer service.  Rooms are spacious.  Have good facilities.  Free WIFI is truly free.  Has Free Pickup and drop service within 3 miles radius which is very useful when you are traveling without vehicle!

Summary Heading: Some good (or great), some not so good
Summary: We were overnight in Irvine on business and chose to stay at the Atrium for its proximity to the freeway and restaurants and for our past experience with the sociable staff and reasonable prices. All-in-all, this hotel is adequate for this purpose. Our room was clean and quiet, and for the most part in good repair.  On the plus side, the in-room Wi-Fi worked well, and I enjoyed the roomy balcony with sliding glass doors, both for reading and for allowing fresh air into the room. Our room overlooked the large and lovely garden and pool area, which has a pool-side bar and separate cabanas with comfy seating.  The two major drawbacks were the postage stamp-size bathroom and the mattress on the king-size bed. The dimly-lit bathroom lacks any hardware near the sink to hang a towel or

Due to some flight cancellations, I had to stay here in March of 2015. The front desk staff were terribly rude, one guy told me the room would be ready by 2. When I returned from a lunch run at 2, a woman with some kind of foreign accent "helped" me at the desk and said the room would be ready at 4. When I said that the other guy (who was still right there and I gestured towards him) said it would be 2:00, she interrupted me mid-sentence and said "4:00 sir." and the guy sheepishly hid behind his computer screen. After she stepped away, he gave me my room with an attitude like I just got him in trouble.   When I got to to the room, there was an elder funk smell to it that made me think this was a thinly veiled econo-lodge in a past-hotel life.   The only saving grace to this

This hotel was booked for me by my employer for a business trip. To start, there is absolutely no parking in front of the hotel to allow for easier check in. They force you to go through the ticketed parking, which is $12 a day. They will validate your ticket so that you can use it upon every entrance throughout your stay. The gate for exit is supposed to block the exit so you would have to use your ticket to get out as well, but for my entire stay it was never down. When I checked out, the desk person seemed surprised that the exit gate was not working.  The room was clean, though it held the typical California mugginess because of its proximity to the beach. The airport did not bother me during my stay. The hairdryer was not attached to the wall and I had to leave it on the

The hotel is literally across the street from John Wayne airport, and is in a fantastic location in Irvine. Near the freeway, South Coast plaza and Newport Beach. Just keep that in mind when you stay here. The hotel from the front is actually very lovely, and the lobby is beautiful. The pool area has cabanas, with music and a bar, and is actually kind of relaxing.   Now for the reality. First off...they really need to work on 'first impressions'. I shouldn't feel like a burden to the front desk for just checking in. A smile goes a long was to a tired traveler. Also... The hotel is old, and that becomes more apparent the farther back into the hotel you go. The property needs some serious love and updating. The halls are dated and just odd. The rooms have been updated as much as

I did not feel welcome to this hotel since day one. I was sick off one of their fish meals and seem to impose them for sprite the following morning even after explaining to them that I had a medical condition, day three I was taking within their three mile shuttle service and informed the driver that I forgot my cell phone and needed to be picked up within an hour. An hour and half passed when I was lucky to be able to get a local to dial the hotel back for me, the caller questioned as to who I was name room number etc. They forgot me and did not even bother to apologize. I would not recommend this hotel to my worst enemy. The Hilton is next door. I tried to get a room there but they were completely booked. The Hilton was such an awesome experience I have been walking to their

Summary Heading: don't judge a book by it's cover
Summary: the hotel has been there a while, as lots of places have in california. it needs a bit of upgrade, but altogether was nice, and had friendly staff, and was very clean. location was great for the airport and close by other areas of interest.the outside area by the pool,ilum lounge, was totally awesome, with cabanas,lounges, tv, music, and some of the best food i have had anywhere.the bar staff was exceptional.

Our flight was cancelled at John Wayne Airport, which is across the street, and needed to find a place ASAP to rest our weary, traveling selves.  Saw this on a search engine, and for the price it was fair for the emergency stay.  Called and was able to make a reservation within 10 minutes.    Shuttle service was fast, but as he arrived he didn't seem very helpful with our luggage, for some reason he got out of the shuttle, went around the back and stood there as if he didn't know what to do.  My mother, who needs wheelchair assistance needed our attention along with my little one, so the luggage was what was left at the curb and he just looked lost and didn't retrieve it right away.  Way to work for your tips!  I was frustrated when I had to hand them to him.  And don't think he

Summary Heading: Close to the airport and good service
Summary: This place is very close to the airport and offers a hotel shuttle. Check in was very easy and they offered to upgrade our room for an additional fee but it was cheap. Rooms are clean and bed was comfortable but the shower would go from hot to cold while showering. Room service was fast as well.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel we have ever stay at!!!!!
Summary: We booked a one night stay at this hotel for my sons Easter break so we could take our three kids to go enjoy their pool. The pool is advertised as heated so we figured even though the weather was not going to be very warm they would still be able to enjoy the pool. When we go there we checked in and went up to our room, we unpacked and turned on the tv come to find out it was not working. We called the front desk and they asked us to switch rooms. We packed all our stuff back up and moved to another room on the same floor. The rooms are very outdated and the carpet is old and smells like mildew. The beds are extremely hard and uncomfortable. Even though we were disappointed with the room we were looking forward to spending some time at the pool. When we got down to the pool we

Summary Heading: My Third Time Staying there for 2 weeks each time.
Summary: I again chose to stay here while attending the Whitaker Wellness Clinic and again was very happy I did.  The personnel are helpful, pleasant, knowledgeable.  I will choose this hotel again when I come back.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for business or pleasure
Summary: The ONLY reason I'm not giving this a perfect rating is because the rooms are very outdated. The restaurant and bar are top notch! Service is impeccable. Since I stayed mid-week, the dining was not crowded. Bartolo, the restaurant supervisor gave me his personal service and made a very stressful business trip the most relaxing part of the entire stay. The food is mouth watering. I tried the special each night and it was 5-star quality dining. Pool/courtyard area make you feel like you're in a tropical paradise - cabanas and all. The hotel lobby is very classy, comfortable and extremely updated. This hotel needs to invest in updating the rooms as much as it has the rest of the property. This could easily be the greatest hotel in the area!

Summary Heading: Maybe they were having an off week?
Summary: Ok, the room was clean, and the bed comfortable, but that was the end of the Pro's, as the Con's outweighed overwhelmingly.    First, this is a business hotel.  Right across the street from the John Wayne Hotel and abutted to a large center of high profile businesses, lots of them.  So many many many guests work in their rooms.   Right from check-in there seemed to be an issue with the WIFI revealed to another staff member as I was checking in.  I specifically asked if my room would be affected and was told it would not be.  Amazingly, the three days there it NEVER worked and ALL of the staff of this hotel seemed shocked and totally without knowledge of the issue. Additionally, there is no way to plug in your laptop either.   In fact our group was repeatedly told different

This property is beautiful, and it's located right across the street from the John Wayne Airport.  I drove in from Ventura County, so it didn't matter where the hotel was located.  I arrived there last Saturday night for a Valentine's Day party at the hotel that night, and was put on the 2nd floor, so it was an easy walk to the ballroom on the same floor.  The pool area reminds me of Las Vegas, with cabanas, and I took advantage of relaxing in one of them on the huge comfortable sofa, while I played on my ipad, since the weather was warm.  I also also ordered lunch at the pool, since the restaurant was closed, which was very good.  My room cost included a buffet breakfast, which for me was just fine.  It was simple and included eggs, bacon, melon, orange juice, milk and coffee.

Summary Heading: Across from the Orange County (SNA) Airport
Summary: We had a one-night stay last November, courtesy of UA, due to a cancelled late night flight.  As we were not familiar with hotels in the area, we were expecting motel-like accomodations.  What a relief to find a small, low-rise, boutique hotel.  Decor is SoCal chic with a hip vibe, esp. with the pool and coutryard.  Very cool lighting at night, with a poolside bar and cabanas. The room was comfortable and modern with good quality furnishings.  Bathroom did have an odd-sized bathtub, that was too short to bathe in.  It would've been better to have a shower only, with a shower door.  While the hotel offered shuttle service, it was just as easy to walk to/from the main terminal (carryon or rollaboard only, of course). But you have to navigate through the airport parking structure

Summary Heading: Very Convenient to the Airport; Comfortable Room
Summary: The Atrium Hotel has an excellent location directly across the street (5 minutes walk) from the John Wayne Airport.  It is moderately priced (i.e. significantly less than the Hilton next door) and has a nice courtyard with a pool.  My room was comfortable, and I did not experience any of the Wi-Fi problems that another reviewer noted.  I asked for a quiet room and received one at the back, well away from the busy 4-lane street in front.  Since I was attending a meeting at the Hilton next door, I did not experience the additional parking charge, but I can understand that would be an annoyance.  It met my needs well, and I would stay there again.

Summary Heading: Great Staff and Location, Time For Some Improvements Though!
Summary: I stay here frequently actually, it's literally a stones throw from John Wayne Airport, the staff is great, oh, and that Pineapple infused water at check-in/check-out that's good, location is phenomenal, unfortunately, and I mean unfortunately as I hope this little Boutique Hotel makes the duly needed updates to keep our hearts!  The ambiance and color and light is something they do well, let's modernize this baby!!  Internet is likely one of the worst I've experience, even considering experiences abroad; and little is done about it, there's just too many people trying to use too little hardware pumping too little bandwidth... upgrade it guys!  (My travel is 99% business, I can't deal with little to no internet as it's a deal breaker).  Food is pretty good, and not too

The picture looked great . When you walk in, you feel like the rest of the stay would be great.Beautiful lobby and outside was pretty for events. When I stay at a hotel , if the rooms are not great than all the beautiful other areas don't matter. The room was a standard Ramada Inn type room.Also to find out on our confirmation that a parking fee was added....gee. no microwave or frig. That would be extra. We have learned better off staYing in the national chains. Not happy with our stay. No jacuzzi either. My fault. Should have called and asked.

Summary Heading: Clean, Friendly Staff, Great Food, Modestly Priced!
Summary: This "airport hotel" is more like a mini resort with a very nice pool, outstanding cabanas, poolside bar and really good restaurant.  The hotel isn't new but has been well maintained and updated with very comfortable beds and good heat/AC systems.  AND, a MUCH better value than the hotel next door.  Free shuttle to/from the airport and to shopping within a 3 mile radius of the hotel.

The hotel was a last minute booking. When I got there they didn't have my reservation and I had to wait, only about 10 minutes. Overall the hotel was clean and the staff was friendly. The pool area was very relaxing and inviting. As for the room itself it was a for my room it was a basic room. I wasnt happy about getting a 8:30 knock on the door from house keeping. I felt rushed to vacate the room. Also would have been nice to have complimentary water instead of having to pay for it. I honestly probably will not stay there again.

I have to admit, I was very reluctant to stay here after reading the reviews and looking through the customer pictures. At the end of the day, the convenience of walking across the street to the airport and the low cost won the day.  When I got to the hotel, I was expecting a dump but it was rather very nice. The staff friendly enough. As I made my way to the room, there is an awesome looking atrium (the the name) with a pool surrounded by cabana's. Looked like a nice place to hang out. Unfortunately I was here on business.  The room itself was big and clean with modern fixtures. The only gripe was that it was on the outside of the complex so I had a wonderful view of the parking lot. Which wasnt that big of a deal except that there were no shear curtains which would have

The hotel was booked for an overnight trip. Rate was good and the room was clean. It was close to the airport and had a shuttle, which is convenient. The front desk staff was a bit unpleasant. I had a half a bathtub in my room. Really? Odd. I thought I booked a room that included breakfast and was denied and told that if I had paid $10 more for my room, it would have been complimentary. Why bother? I would stay here again for a short stay if I had to.

This hotel is conveniently located directly across the street from John Wayne Airport in Irvine, CA.  The rooms are nice but a little aged in styling.  They are nice and comfortable. Finding your room is like working a maze.  However, the pool area is gorgeous.  With some upgrading this could be almost a 3 1/2 to 4 star property. They have a free breakfast that is decent.  One thing that have that you don't see much of anymore is bellman asking to help you with your bags.  If you fly into Orange County, this might be a diamond in the rough,

I stayed the night for an early morning flight. It was booked by my employer.  $12 for parking which was supposed to be charged to the company credit card which instead was charged to mine. Front desk check in not friendly. Getting to the rooms are a maze. You have to go thru many different doors to reach the room. The room smelled musty, air conditioner did not adequately cool room. Toiletries nice, shower kind of odd. The open area had cabanas. I only saw the hotel at night which was lit up by colorful lights. I would not choose to stay here again.

Stayed one night for business trip. All the other neighbor hotel was sold out and had not much choices. Upon checking in, I liked the resort feel lobby. Nice reception area, though I had a feeling by reception staff that this may not a good hotel. Bingo! Once I got in the room, I realized my bad feeling was right. Room itself is old. Sands on carpet. Trash behind chair. Iron board was just nasty. No furniture in a kind of nice terrace. The highlight was a big roach on a terrace trying to get in my room. Paid over $120 a night and this was what I got.  In short, house keeping doesn't do the job. Filthy room. Never again.

Sure this hotel has some issues, but overall I'm still giving it a solid 3 stars.   Positives:  Fantastic pool area, Large private balcony in room, comfortable updated bedding and hotel was literally walking distance from the airport   Negatives: The hotel itself is very dated......The hallways and elevators in particular looked pretty rough. The fitness center is small and lackluster. WIFI was very weak.  Overall I still have to give this place 3 stars. It was pretty dated, but at least the bedding was new and comfy, which can make or break a hotel for me. And while the room was kind of small, I had a huge balcony to sit and soak up that great California weather each evening. I barely spent any time in the room, as the balcony was so nice. Also, the pool area is fantastic to

Summary Heading: Past glory lives on with a little less sparkle
Summary: This non-chain hotel was once a fantastic location with all the amenities and located right across the street for Santa Anna Airport (SNA), but the place has not really kept up with the times.  If you are looking for a nicely priced place with clean (all be it very small) rooms you got it, if your looking to impress (as most do in O.C.) better off looking elsewhere.  Positives - Clean rooms, nice courtyard with pools, cabanas and bar all staff with great people  Negatives - Waiting for ever to get buzzed out of the hotel‚Äôs parking lot that you pay extra for.  Rooms that are both small and not well insulated from the noise of the airport a few thousand feet away.

First thing I want to say is about front desk people- snobby and not nice... Front desk Asian lady was not nice from first second we got there. She was giving us attitude the whole time.  This hotel has great pool area with outdoor bar and nice hangout area.   We got room on first floor- at night we had room full of bugs I had to call front desk and ask for new room. We got room on 3rd floor - open our balcony door and some last downstairs was screaming at us not to smoke on patio ( non of us are smokers)  After all this I asked for free breakfast and free parking gentlemen at front desk give to us that's why I'm giving two stars.   This hotel should really work on better customer service!!!  Nice place to stay

Summary Heading: Wish we could have made it a longer stay
Summary: We should have planned the last few days of our trip a little better, and had I have done, I would have made it a two night stay at the Atrium instead of just one.  A very helpful Jessica (?) at the front desk helped me book a room by phone early in the morning, and understanding we were traveling with children she arranged an early check in for us. That really made a huge difference to our day.  The property may be older but I found the lobby and pool/lounge area very nice (like what they're doing with the cabanas by the pool bar....wish we had time to enjoy that). Our room was spacious, clean and comfortable and we had no complaints with WIFI or parking.  After an extremely long day and some unexpected time in traffic we made it back to the hotel just in time to eat before the

The hotel is right across from the airport and close to many things. The bathroom in our room needed some touch ups there was wall paper falling off the wall. Large rooms though and very comfortable. We had a very helpful staff that wanted to make sure our stay was comfortable.

Summary Heading: This hotel definitely needs a make-over, but is still a good deal
Summary: I usually stay elsewhere when visiting the area, but my stay was only to be a quick business trip overnight. My usual hotel was booked so I had to find other accommodations. The Atrium needs an update, however the beds are very comfortable,however the pillows and linens are very old in need of replacement. The bathrooms are dreary and lighting poor. The internet connectivity was spotty at best. On the positive side, the breakfast buffet was surprising good. My room was $100.00 less than I usually pay and helped make up for some of the shortfalls on the property.  This hotel definitely needs a make-over, but has the bones to be a great hotel. Being right across the street from the John Wayne Airport is a definite plus.

Summary Heading: No complaints from me...I loved it!!
Summary: This was my first time staying with the Atrium Hotel and we LOVED IT.  The reason why we loved it, was because T.H.E. Show at Newport was in town (May 30, 31, June 1, 2014) all three days and last year when T.H.E Show (Newport) was goin on, we had to stay at the Marriott (which was OK for a major hotel chain) BUT, when I FINALLY booked a room at the Atrium, I was over the entire moon! The ONLY thing was we couldn't check in early, which was ok... we dealt with it.  The overall staff was WONDERFUL!!  It's a boutique hotel and we loved the overall vibe.  The bathroom was less to be desired, the bed and balcony were clean and GRRREAT!!  We enjoyed every minute of it and we would definitely stay again.

The internet is terrible. It only allows four devices per room, and the connection is very unstable. The breakfast is poor too: always the same every morning, and they always forget to give me coffee.

We stayed here because of an early morning flight. We literally walked across the street to John Wayne Airport. Accommodations were basic & that is all we needed. Room was clean & had a balcony but no provisions to sit on it. Restaurant had a basic menu & was averaged priced. Would stay there again for the convenience.

Never again! Staff was not service oriented, no one helped us with luggage, or even provided us a cart, and we were there for 3 nights for a soccer tournament.  We had a lot of luggage, which we had to trek around parking lot, through pool and cabana area and back into main hotel. We had 5 rooms reserved all at same price for our soccer families.  One family had a room half the size of the others.  Rooms do not have refrigerators, which was a big bummer. Poolside area "looks" nice, but is not maintained well and has travertine tile which is very slippery everywhere.  Many areas the tiling was uneven and had pooled water.  My daughter fell twice, neither time had she been swimming, just walking by the cabana.  Another parent also slipped. No cautionary yellow signs were placed.

on the outside the hotel looks great. However....the rooms are circa 1978 and are in need of a major facelift. The breakfast that was included with this rate was a complete joke. it was equivalent to jail food consisting of breads and weak coffee. To be frank, I had a massive cockroach in my room. Avoid this place

Summary Heading: Looks nice from the outside but.....
Summary: Room was really bad - have stayed in better in rural mid west small towns - expect much more in that area!  Room was very humid when we got there and it took forever for the AC unit to cool it down.  Musty smell never left. The bathroom had peeling drywall tape and rusted door frame. Overall not a nice place to stay.

This hotel is conveniently located near the airport, easy to find and a place to sleep. The rooms are nothing fancy but we paid $109/night and figured this would be the case. Most of the time we were there, there were loud, obviously intoxicated guests in a mid 20's age group. The walls are thin enough to hear much of what is going on in the hallways and next door.  When we checked in the lady at the desk didn't smile once during our 10 minute interaction. She was incredibly mundane and even rolled her eyes at me as I walked away. Be aware that this hotel has a list of rules that they request their guests follow - nothing outrageous, pretty standard however along with my signature she requested my small children to also sign. Upon my questioning of this, she promptly told me it

Nice pool bar, but the rooms are crowded, outdated, and dirty.  Pool area has broken tiles, and needs attention.  The bathroom door hits the toilet when it closes.  This place needs to be updated and modernized.  Some hallway areas smelled like deep fried fish guts.

This hotel ridiculously charges a self parking fee to its so called guests. You have no other option to pay it or scavenge for free parking miles down the street. Admittedly it is not a large amount of money but the principle is what truly sickens me. When I spoke with the manager about this he claimed that it was due to the fact that it was a "prime location". The prime location he spoke of is near empty lot, more like just an excuse to extort it from hard working customers.

You can tell this hotel has some age on it, but you can also see that effort has gone into it to make it nice. The pool area is just lovely. There are many palm trees and they have quite a few nice cabanas that are ideal for families and groups (and couples and individuals!) to do some hanging out. At night, the pool area is lighted with changing colored lights and it is very lovely! It is an ideal area for socializing, resting, reading and swimming. There is a bar area also.  The hotel is a bit difficult to navigate. It felt like a maze to me. Also, there were no luggage carts and parking is rather far if you have a lot of luggage to carry in (I do believe there is a bellhop though.)  All of the staff members that I dealt with were courteous. I did deal with one nice employee

I stayed at the Atrium for the first time, last week.  The hotel was chosen by locals for me, as I was completely unfamiliar with it.  The hotel grounds, and the lobby, are quite attractive.  The lobby makes excellent use of mirrors and plants to appear larger and restful.  In addition to the main lobby, a secondary lounge area is available (turn left after passing the front desk, then immediately on your right). Cool water, with lemon, is available in the entryway.  Guests on wheeled devices should think twice.  Many floor areas are flagstones that can be difficult to traverse.  Many (most?) guest rooms are a difficult journey from the lobby for wheels.  The front desk was a mixture ... one clerk quickly helpful, one a bit interested in the ladies.  Another time, it took

The Atrium seems like a Ho Jos that got a nice facelift.  Lobby, pool, bar are lovely.  Rooms are decent.  I stayed in one of the King suites.  It was very spacious but there was no AC vent in the bedroom and only blackout curtains on the windows to balcony.  The bedroom gets too hot when the blinds are open and you can't enjoy the Californian Sun without giving up all privacy.  Lastly, the internet is SLOW! When it works.  In my 2 week stay it didn't work for 7 days. It's wireless only and there is no wired backup.  If you need a place to stay for a night or two, this place would be fine though.

Checked in on a Sunday night for a business conference through Wednesday. the front lobby was nicely updated and very welcoming. Hotel staff were courteous & friendly, but the whole check-in procedure was slow and tedious. After being told to drive to the rear of the property, had to walk through a security door entry to gain access to the property; it felt like walking into an apartment complex in a rough neighborhood. Took the elevator to the top floor (3rd) and entered my room. It was kind of a let down as I took my first few steps. First thing I notice were the popcorn ceilings. (Yikes!) I went to put something in the fridge so I could heat up my take-out dinner I picked up on the way and guess what; no mini fridge or microwave. (What year is this?) So what's next after

I have been staying at the Atrium for about a year now for business.  During my last visit the elevator was not working and MIGUEL worked very hard to find me a room on the ground floor and even upgraded my room.  I have never met a more professional, caring individual.  I highly recommend the Atrium.  The rooms are excellent, room service is excellent and the staff, especially MIGUEL - he makes the Atrium.

Summary Heading: Racist hotel, black people stay away
Summary: Black people hoping to check in early are left waiting in the lobby, while they check in white people to supposedly unavailable rooms. Please do not patronize this hotel. This is not the first time this has happened, unfortunately my husband inadvertantly booked me here again at a discounted rate, but the racist attitudes are too much to compensate for the discounted rate.

This is our second time at this hotel.  In fact, my wife asked me to book this hotel again because she felt so comfortable here when we stayed 3 weeks ago.  The rooms and the property are very clean, and the hotel staff is amazingly pleasant; they all love the property and many have worked here for several years.  One of the waiters has been here since day one.  The pool area is awesome, reminds me of properties you will find in Palm Springs.  The hotel is older, but kept up.  The bathrooms are small but clean and the tub/shower is the most unique we have ever experienced in the US.  Come for a visit, you'll be back.  Also, the hotel is convenient to the Orange County Airport and 2 very good restaurants, El Torito and Gulliver's Prime Rib House.   T.Young

Summary Heading: Atrium is excellent choice to stay
Summary: I have to frequent down to Irvine on a regular basis and I make my stay at the Atrium Irvine right across from JWA. The staff are all very personable and professional. It's hard to single any one out but Janet, Jessica, Stephanie and Maola ( sorry if I butchered her name) lol are one of the main reasons I stay there. They provide excellent customer service which is my main reason when I go anywhere They get brownie points for welcoming me by my name when I come up to the front desk.They strive to be customer concentric.  The rates are very reasonable for around that area. Nice rooms and they have a pool area with cabanas and bar. :)  I will continue to frequent there for all of the above. Well done ladies, kudos for the awesome service.

Location location location this hotel is right next to the airport. Flying in or out of John Wayne airport, this is the hotel for you. Everything is within a quarter of a mile of the hotel. You would never know that your next to an airport the grounds are well-kept, the courtyard is beautiful pool and bar very nice. The only problem I had was the room smelled very musty even with the air conditioning on and the slider to the court yard open the musty smelling won't go away.

Summary Heading: Great value, clean, amazing pool/bar and pleasant staff.
Summary: I have stayed at this hotel three times.  It's always been a great experience so much so that I did not even bother checking online for other hotels for this present stay.  I knew where I wanted to be.  The hotel staff are great.  In particular a front desk staff member by the name of "Miguel. P" was very helpful and attended to our needs speedly.  The hotel is located close to the 405 interstate, the South Coast Plaza shopping mall and a few minutes drive to Newport and Laguna Beaches.  John Wayne Aiport is also located across the street.  The airport air traffic is some how not very loud.  You can barely hear the aircraft taking off and landing.  The beds are really comfortable, sheets are clean and rooms are quiet.  All in all this place has everything I ever need.

Summary Heading: Last minute stay turned out okay
Summary: I missed my flight and needed a place to stay for the night.  I walked across the street, presented a credit card and got a room.  I was only there for about 8 hours so I didn't have a lot of experience with it but I'll say this:  The room was clean, although not terribly new or fancy.  It was safe and convenient as well.  I asked for and received a wake up call.  I didn't eat or drink there, so I can't comment on the food, but I got a room last minute and everything worked out fine.

The outdoor areas are beautiful and relaxing. The staff are friendly and helpful. But the rooms, while clean and spacious, are simply old. They have been updated, but things like the popcorn ceilings and open closet area show its age. Overall, this is a perfectly adequate hotel if you need it for convenience (i.e., attending a training or need somewhere walking distance to the airport).

Summary Heading: Nice pool area, but dated and dirty rooms!
Summary: On the plus side, the pool area was a pleasant surprise.  It's small, but tastefully decorated with nice furniture and small cabanas.  On the negative side, the rooms are VERY dated and dirty. I made the mistake of looking under the bed to find what seemed like years of dust and hair build up on the disgusting carpet, as well as candy wrappers and a dead bug carcass.  Thankfully, I found a room at a near-by Fairmont that was a few dollars more, but worth every penny.

Large rooms, adequate free breakfast buffet, free shuttle to and from airport. Nice property. One problem is you can't pull up outside the door to check in or out without using the valet. Wifi is not reliable. Good for a night stay before a departure.

Summary Heading: Good Facilities and People Bad Rooms
Summary: Stayed on business for a few days. The facilities and the people are excellent, so if thats important to you customer service is great. The rooms however are outdated, not very clean, and quite frankly not worth the stay. For a hotel in Irvine you'd think the quality would have been better.

I am sitting in my Atrium hotel room and just read "Tired's" review and I agree wholeheartedly. Great pool area, freezing pool, so my swim suit will stay in the suitcase. Big room but it is musty smelly, and I kept my socks on so as to not walk on the grubby carpet. I was here 2 years ago and it was at least pleasant so I tried again. But when I got here the desk clerk was missing and when he looked at my booking docs he tried to upcharge me 10. and then said he could not see a run down of my daily rate as there was only a total. i told him to divide the total by 2 - the number of nights I was staying! Only then did he drop the extra $10. Big room, no microwave, or fridge, only 1 chair and no easy chair to even relax in. We are keeping the sliding door open all night due to the

This hotel was excellent. Staff very friendly. Shuttle service goes 3 mile radius for free, so they took me to shopping centre and picked me up. The Pool area is beautiful at night.  They took me to the airport in the morning. Free wifi. Comfy bed. One of the best places I have stayed. Low price for exceptional value.

Summary Heading: Very Convenient for Orange County (John Wayne) Airport stay
Summary: My wife and I stayed here again, getting a good price at pr-celine.com and were quite satisfied. The room was clean and the service was friendly.  There is one major reason you might want to stay here--it is the most convenient walking distance hotel from Orange County airport (John Wayne) SNA.  We wanted to avoid an extra day car rental fee when we arrived so we ate dinner at the airport (Ruby's Diner) and walked with our luggage to the hotel (It's through the parking garage and across MacArthur Boulevard, next to the Chevron station which is next to the Bank of America) Right next door is the more expensive Hilton. There is an Enterprise Car Rental location right in the hotel, but all the other companies have shop in the airport.

The people and pool lounge are definitely the high points. The rooms are sufficient but the low Popcorn ceilings do give it dated feel despite the flat screen tv's and rooms. That said, the lounge area makes up for a lot as does the friendly staff. Not the highest rated but one to consider for sure.

Here on business. The hotel is old and tired and the rooms need serious updating. The bathrooms have not been touched in years. If the company spent at much money and attention to detail on the rooms as they do the pool area it would be fabulous. The rooms smell very musty and the carpet is gross. I would not recommend and would not return.

The staff was helpful and friendly.  Relaxing in the cabanas near the pool was great!  The food was very good!  The room was clean and comfortable.  It was nice that we could not hear the planes from the John Wayne Airport across the street.  Thank you Atrium for a pleasant stay!

This hotel is RIGHT across the street from the John Wayne Orange County Airport.  The staff is freindly and helpful.  I come here every Tuesday to enjoy their poolside bar and really great food.  Love their Kobe Beef burgers with sweet potato fries. We rent out rooms for many events as this place has free parking and the best location in OC!

Stayed the  week while I was in town for a training class.  Right across street from airport and half the price of neighboring hilton and others. Good value for clean rooms.  You will need to walk a quarter mile to 1/2 mile to find restaurant so keep that in mind if you don't have a car.
