Summary Heading: Good value but occasional lapses lower rating
Summary: First impressions of this hotel are very favourable, and during a week's stay we were never uncomfortable, but despite the great price for our room, some details did begin to chip away at the quality experience on offer at this hotel.  Good points: Lobby very smart, central pool area clean and verging towards chic, cleanliness of rooms excellent, service on the whole fine, walking distance to airport, very helpful concierge/valet service, rooms at rear of hotel quiet and sleep quality was good. Car hire office in the lobby (but cheaper deals available in airport).  Weak points:  -Breakfast was exactly the same every day, and not great quality -Coffee served at breakfast borderline undrinkable - ask for tea instead -Service in restaurant is OK, nothing more. Not unpleasant, but

My friends and I have had several dinners/get-togetherness at the Atrium Hotel over the past few years.  The hotel staff is very nice and attentive.  The hotel restaurant has a wide variety of delicious food.  The cabanas outside by the pool were comfortable and relaxing.

Atrium hotel is by far the best place I have stayed.  The staff are friendly , rooms are clean , food is excellent.  Good price too ! The location is unbeatable, directly across from John Wayne airport.  They also have weekly live band by the poolside at night with large turnout of people just partying having a good time. I would definitely stay in Atrium again and again

Summary Heading: A True Home Away from Home
Summary: I have always enjoyed my visits to the Atrium Hotel. The rooms, bar, outdoor entertainment, restaurants and overall service are all excellent. It's comfortable and cool, classy yet quaint. It's my favorite among the numerous accommodations outside of John Wayne Airport simply because it really does make you feel at home. I smile just thinking of my next visit.

A reservation was made for me on Kayak.com but I did not have the conf. # w/me. Upon check in, They could not find me in their system - but the man was very nice and gave me a room that was only $1.00 more than what I was quoted on Kayak. You do A LOT of walking in this hotel.  Doesn't seem like quite enough elevators for me, but it wasn't that bad! The hotel grounds around the pool are BEAUTIFUL! The cabanas, etc. what a nice touch! The rooms are nice, nothing special but adequate for business travelers.  Some of the hallways are a little run down, but nothing awful! Nice restaurant, and the manager was very nice. Only negative I have is that there is no patio furniture on the balcony to sit on and look out at the pool!  I believe their web site claimed it had patio furniture,

Summary Heading: Nice ambiance, friendly staff, quality food & reasonable price
Summary: Very convenient location, right across the airport and near restaurants.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Lovely ambiance in pool area with the cabanas and bonus weekly live music.  Food price is reasonable and good quality.  I came to visit a friend staying there and the room facing the pool is very nice.  The pool area is beautifully illuminated at night.

Summary Heading: EXCELLENT SERVICE, VERY ACCOMMODATING, DELICIOUS FOOD, BEAUTIFUL BANQUET ROOMS!
Summary: LOVE this place!! We planned a party in the banquet room and the staff was sooo friendly!  They were sooo helpful and went over and above what was expected!  They accommodated our time to come and decorate and assisted us in all our needs!  There were so many compliments on the food!!  In fact, we've eaten at the restaurant there and the service and food is the same!  They treat you like first class!  The banquet rooms are beautiful and has a patio area and big waiting area.  Also very convenient for our out-of-town guests who flew into John Wayne airport!  Highly recommend this place and will book another event!

Summary Heading: Nice Place, Easy on the Wallet, I'll Be Back!
Summary: I had some business in Irvine and this hotel was SO what I needed.  First of all, it's so close to the airport, I almost felt guilty about renting a car.  Surprisingly, I didn't hear any airplanes.  I had a good few nights' sleep in a big, comfy bed.  The rooms are a little dated, but they are good and well-kept.  Whenever I stay somewhere, I like to snoop around and peek into the conference rooms and event spaces.  Definitely a good place for meetings.  Irvine is a nice city and The Atrium fits in.  Everything is close; great restaurants, in all price ranges, convenience stores and drugstores, Starbucks (!), my gym, movie theaters, and great shopping not too far away.  That said, you never have to leave the hotel.  Great, reasonably-priced food at the restaurant, free internet,

Summary Heading: Best walking distant to airport, amazing pool and bar and live music!
Summary: Most convenient location! Staff is very friendly and pool and bar and live music is amazing! Great food as well! I would definitely recommend it. Poolside cabanas are great with TV in each of them. Great place to meet business clients or relax with family. Try the burger!

I have stayed at this hotel twice a year over the past 5 years and always found it very comfortable. They offer a shuttle bus from John Wayne Airport, South Coast Plaza and Fashion Island. The pool area and cabanas are lovely with music playing and lovely lighting in the evenings. The front desk staff have always been a bit disorganized, not able to cope with early check in, but pleasant enough, with the valets always friendly and helpful. There is a gas station next door, so I was able to buy fresh milk, only thing is the rooms didn't have a fridge, so had to use the ice bucket and ice vending machine. Being an international traveler it was helpful to use the laundry as well. I always enjoyed my stay here for business.

Hotel was very centrally located with easy freeway access to the locations I needed to get to in Orange County.  Very accomodating stay and the food was great!  I had a nice balcony room overlooking the pool and they had wonderful live entertainment.  I especially loved the poolside bar and cabanas.  Free internet access so I could complete my business in a bright, sunny room.  Despite previous reviews the hotel was a pleasant surprise!

Based on other reviews, I was hesitant, but had a very nice stay.  The hotel is older.  I would not stay here for a vacation, but for business travel it was totally fine.  To tell the truth, it reminded me of going to grandma's house.  Old, but nice and comfortable. I had a room on the 3rd floor overlooking the interior courtyard/pool.  The bed was very comfortable and the room was on the larger side with a nice large desk.  I was only in the room to sleep and shower but my time there was uneventful - no problems.    Parking is $12/day but nearly every hotel in Orange County charges a parking fee so it should not surprise anyone.  The only thing I have to say negative is that the hotel charged my credit card $4 for a bottled water that I did not consume.  I've had this happen at

Front desk staff is very odd; when we tried to check out, they had 3 folks hunched over and agonizing over the computer, and a line backing up behind. Rather than take one of those people to assist the other guests, all 3 kept trying to help that one guest. Pool area was nice, grounds were ok, but rooms were mediocre at best. Musty smell and run-down looking.  Staff is friendly. Restaurant staff is friendly, but food was tasteless; tried eating breakfast there once, never again.

Old, dated, smelly hotel.  Valet staff friendly but front desk overworked.  Concerned about security on back door that wasn't closing properly.  Especially in light of three apparent prostitutes working the grounds.  The only positive is convenience to the highway and airport.  If this is your choice, reconsider!

Lobby, pool, patio bar and staff were excellent.  The rooms were mediocre at best.  Air conditioner was freezing cold and couldn't adjust.  Pocket door for bathroom was broken, maintenance never came to fix it. On the positive side:  the mattress and pillows were heavenly.  The restaurant was sorely understaffed to accommodate the large groups being hosted by the hotel, and the food was nothing special. If you want to lounge by the pool and soak up the sun while enjoying a delicious rum drink, then the atmosphere is wonderful. Convenient and friendly hotel shuttle service anywhere within 3 miles gets you to a wide array of restaurants, shopping, and movie theaters as well as to the airport across the street.

The only positive note is the  hotel pool is awesome ....... Rooms are out dated and have a musty smell as well as a damp feel to them, 19" TV made in the 80's, 2 outlets in the whole room. Also want to state they didn't not honor the military discount on their website 20% off the best rate....SHAME ON YOU!  Stay across the street at the Hilton...it's about the same price when you add on the parking$12 a day and breakfast charge of $12... Hope this helps someone make a better choice than I did.

PRO -  Very convenient to airport (right across street) -  Price OK for the area  CONS -  rooms mediocre -  desk service inefficient.   -  room not ready by check in time (and give up hope of checking in early). -  parking is an additional charge at $12 per day. - not a lot of plugs for device charging

Summary Heading: Okay for a stay at a conference
Summary: This hotel is basically fine for what you would likely need a conference hotel to do, house you while you attend sessions. It has a lot of atmosphere in the evenings, with colored lights around a bar in its namesake atrium exposed to the California evening breezes, but the rest of the day is fairly average. We had a room next to the iron gate separating that atrium from the parking lot, and did get bothered by the clanging shut of that gate at all hours - we'd specifically request a different room next time. Also, it was hard to get anybody's attention at the main desk outside of the most common check-in and check-out hours. But the place wasn't bad, and we'd stay there again.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel for a short stay.
Summary: I stayed here for an event and it was pretty decent. Nice lobby area, nice pool area, and friendly staff. The rooms aren't too great as far as bedding, decor and ambiance go but mine was clean. Self parking lot was $12 per night with in and out privileges. Valet parking is also available. Overall not bad, but I haven't stayed anywhere else in the area to compare.

Summary Heading: Did not honor reservation, rude, gross room
Summary: I made a reservation through Hotels.com 6 weeks in advance and called to confirm the week before (spoke with someone about the airport shuttle). After flying from DC to California, I was told there was no reservation in the system. After 20 mins of arguing with the manager (I had a print out of my confirmation email) he "found" the reservation. The room had 1 king bed for 3 adults (room 382). After I complained that the reservation called for 2 beds I was reassigned a handicap room on the first floor ( room 107) that was so disgusting and smelly. No spread or pillow cases on the beds, moldy smell to the room and stuffy.   I complained again only to be told there were no more rooms and if I didn't like it I could call Hotels.com to get out of it. Did i mention my credit card had

The location is excellent and directly across the street from the Orange County airport; which is the only reason I suspect this hotel is still in business  Hotel advertises a guaranteed check in @ 3pm; I arrived early at 2:35pm and was told check in was @ 3pm and to come back then.  I came back a little after 3pm and was told to come back closer to 3:30; I returned @ 3:30 and was checked in but the receptionist said she had to keep my keys until she had confirmation that my room was ready.  She told me to come back in 10 minutes. I came back and was given my keys.  When I arrived @ my room the door was open and there was a maid still working on the room.  I went back to reception (now 4pm) and asked for a room that was done.  I was given a new room and when I arrived @ my

Yes, it is inexpensive, however I would highly recommend booking elsewhere.  Rooms, small, smell, poor working television, rude staff that has no intention of being helpful or attempting to make the stay pleasant.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for the $. Fun, friendly and SUPER pool area!
Summary: I'm in between homes and have been staying here with my service dog on and off for the past month. I like this place. The staff are super friendly, helpful and professional. I like that the hotel has a small gym and coin opp laundry. The pool area is really nice with little cabanas with comfy couches, power points for computers and wifi available. It's a great place to just hang out and chill. My room faces the pool so it can get a little noisy on some weekend nights as they sometimes have events with live music. All rooms have balconies with large sliding glass doors. There's a gas station next door for cold drinks and snacks and plenty of restaurants close by. 24 hour fitness is right around the corner and GREAT shopping just 5 min away. Expect to pay extra for parking,

I stayed at this hotel because of the good reviews and because it was not your regular chain hotel. I was disappointed. The lobby and the rooms smelled bad. The staff was not very friendly or helpful as we noticed them arguing with guests that came up to the front desk on several occasions. Our room keys did not work everytime we would leave the room making it necessary to go back down to the front desk. The upside is the location and the free breakfast, although I would not stay here again.

I took my boys last year for a week, and was surprised at how great the hotel was for the price. I have stayed in numerous five star hotels and was expecting this to be pretty drab, I will agree It is a little outdated, but for the price and location its perfect. Just minutes from Newport and Huntington Beach, we loved the hotel and the town of Irvine so much we booked another trip for next month.

The staff was excellent...and helpful.  The room was ok, and had decent beds.  But the door stuck so you had to push it open.  Had reserved a room overlooking the pool...and got a room overlooking the parking lot.  Just as well as the "heated pool" was not heated...and was freezing.  Very few lounge chairs around pool, but it did have many "cabanas" to sit in, and they were comfortable. Room was clean; just dated. Looked around for a hot tub, but did not find one. VERY convenient to the airport, which was a huge plus.  They also have an Enterprise car rental at their hotel...next time I will know.

Hi, I stayed at the Atrium hotel for one night in the third week of June 2013. The hotel is very pleasant. Unlike what the other reviewers said, the hotel rooms looked clean and comfortable to me. The poolside bar was very relaxing and the overall ambience was wonderful. Breakfast was good, standard hotel continental stuff. The only catch was the internet access. The internet access in the room was too slow. Overall, fantastic hotel if you are visiting for a holiday. For business trips, the internet can be troublesome.

Agree that the room finishes were outdated, and the place had a "past its prime" feeling overall.  But our room and balcony were clean and comfortable.  The pool area was huge and surprisingly quiet, given the location.  Convenient to the airport.  Friendly, helpful staff, decent breakfast.  Good value. We will stay again.

The only thing I enjoyed about this place was entrance. It has a decent feel to it. But the rooms are dark and need updating... the price was not bad for the location, HOWEVER...they dont tell you until you arrice that the Parking is an extra fee $15,00! They also do not include any breakfast with the rate but manage to take your money gladly for the parking. Embassy on Dyer road just about a mile away has FREE parking and FREE full cooked to order breakfast and happy hour the night you check in. We went there our second night....I wish I would have stayed there both nights! I would NOT recomend this place at all!

This place was very nice, I came in from SNA & wanted to stay near the airport. Again, I read all of the reviews of the hotel before I get it...I don't see what the negative reviewers have seen. The reviews they leave are recent enough, but I never encounter what they do. The rooms are very nice. Service was great, although I did encounter a problem there. The breakfast... :). Again, this is something that you should come & see for yourself. If you don't need much, they give you more than enough :D! If you know you don't need the extra luxuries, but would like a nice place to stay, this is it!  As to my problem mentioned earlier with service, It wasn't that they had messed up with my reservations, but there was one person at the front desk & a moderate amount of people waiting

Hotel needs major improvements. Rooms had a terrible smell, 19 inch tv, uncomfortable beds,  dirty chairs.  Our grandson found a spider in his bed.  Would not recommend this hotel.  When we got to the hotel parking not good and you are charged 12.00 a day. Other hotels across the way don't charge.  Had a reservation wrong.   Noisy level was loud and no sleep.

Rooms in this hotel are old and in need of desperate update and style. Bathrooms have really old fixture that made leaking noises all night. Bed was too soft. Carpet in the room looked like it hadn't been cleaned for a while. Sink was cracked. You don't necessary expect to see a rundown room when you stay at a hotel at this price range. Outside areas (pool, lobby, and hallway) are nicely maintained but rooms are far from it. Overall, it was a bad hotel for the price.

I had a pleasant stay of three nights.  The staff was very friendly and accommodating.  Walking distance from the airport.  Quiet room facing the inner courtyard.  Good climate control (A/C) in the room.    My room included breakfast, which was also surprisingly good.  (The buffet had hot eggs, bacon, etc..)

Summary Heading: Depends what you are looking for in your stay
Summary: Had the filled in circles been about the actual rating of the property as in the room, then I would have given this hotel less circles....however basing the review on the overall value of the room/hotel/accommodations, they get three stars.  The Atrium needs work as far as the hotel room itself. It was musty, I smelled smoke in the entrance, the elevators barely work and there is a water closet for a bathroom.  However the hotel is centrally located for the airport, they have a shuttle that can take you anywhere for a three mile radius, it included breakfast the next day (not just cereal), included free wifi and parking (hard to come by).  There is also some beautiful posh vegas style heated cabanas by the pool to hang out in. Totally doesn't fit with the rest of the offerings,

Summary Heading: I second that "Run down and dirty" review!
Summary: I had a remodeled room.....and yes, I'd hate to see what the old rooms look like, of which they still have quite a few I hear. The beds were comfortable, but you can hardly sleep because you can hear neighbors on both sides. I actually had someone knock on my door at midnight asking if they could climb through my balcony and into their room because they had locked themselves out of their room, TRUE STORY, I kid you not! No way to reheat food, no way to keep things chilled except those ice buckets they give you. The internet is spotty. They have 1/2 tubs, so don't think about having a relaxing bath. I had never seen a 1/2 tub before. My view was of a parking lot, and a trashed backyard area. I have never written a review before, but I HAD to this time. I was really disappointed,

My two sons and I stayed here because the water polo team decided it was close to the pools we were going to. It was not. We were NOT advised that parking would be $12/day. "Breakfast" was included, horrible powedered eggs and bacon. The first night, the heater didn't work and we asked for blankets but our heads froze. There was hair on my sheets and the top sheet was dirty on the edges. There was a urine stain (or something of that color) on the sink. A small TV from the 70s and two tiny double beds. The next morning a maintenance guy came to repair the heater, and I left the room. When we returned at night, the heater was working and set at 90 degrees. Everthing we touched in the room was boiling hot. So now we had heat, but the heater was making a noise that resembled rain

Summary Heading: For the price I expected more.
Summary: For the price I expected more, I'm not going to say that the hotel is bad, but, for what they charge I did expect more, the hotel rooms seem old and also the furniture, I could have expected a something nicer, also $12 for parking seems a bit excessive. The complementary breakfast is nothing out of this wold, fruit, yogurt, cereal, eggs, potatoes, bacon, OJ and coffee. If you are heading to the Irvine area I'm sure you can do better. Look around!

Before checking in to this hotel I had read the reviews and learned there were two types of rooms: old/dingy and remodeled/decent. I arrived very late, exhausted from a day's travel and specifically asked for a remodeled room.  If this is remodeled, I'd hate to see the old. The room smells musty, is dirty, & Noisy. Doors and vents have dirt marks. PILLOW CASE HAD MAKE-UP ON IT!! I WILL NOT BE BACK AND DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL.

I recently finished a two night stay at the Atrium Hotel near John Wayne Airport in Santa Ana. Although I frequently travel in this area I typically do not stay at airport hotels since there are more exciting areas to stay. However, since I was on business and arrived late I checked into the Atrium Hotel. The staff at the hotel was top notch, but I have to say that I am ONLY talking about the hotel staff members at the front desk and NOT the Valet people (which I am not sure if that was a separate company or not). The lady at the front desk was nice and moved me to a close room. The room itself was nice for the fact that it had a patio and the bed was comfy. The bathroom was quite cramped with just a shower and a toilet. The sink area was also quite small. I did have room

This was a pleasant place to stay for one night. The staff was very friendly and the hotel was very clean. Just a few things to note:  Parking is not free. Overnight guest parking is $12.00. Valet is $14.00. If you lose your parking ticket, they will charge you $40.00 so hang on to that!  There is a restaurant in the hotel. We did not eat there because I was under the impression that we got a complimentary breakfast.  Overall, nice hotel.

Summary Heading: dingy, musty smell, simply nasty. beware!
Summary: This hotel is absolutely disgusting. The smell is keeping me awake at night so I opened the window to get fresh air even though it is freezing outside. The room is filthy and the bathroom makes you feel like taking another shower. The lobby and pool area look very nice, but who cares if your room is less than desirable. The doors slam hard so prepare to be jolted at night. The furniture is old and beat up. People staying here are questionable too. Book at your own risk and don't say I did not warn you.

Summary Heading: OK if you are stuck near SNA
Summary: The hotel is practically on the Orange County airport (SNA) and there aren't many other choices. If you have an early plane (or arrive late) you will get  a bed for the night, in a reasonable room (if it has been remodeled!). You will also get a random mix of good and very surly service, poorly marked and lit corridors and overpriced food. You will get  as well as bizarre instructions in the room binder explaining how things work, which do not correspond to reality (some of it is not bad: the binder says no wifi, but there is). If you want to print your boarding pass, it'll cost you several dollars.

This was the prefect place for our awesome event,, I'M so happy that we picked this hotel,,Not only was the $ right but the hotel was fantastic,, THE rooms were so so so nice and clean,, AND the pool area was so pretty and  the lighting at night was so romantic and so relaxing,, I love the cabana's at night,, Just to relaxes and convivial with a drink,, THE pool bar was so AWESOME!! Thank you for making our stay so fantastic and being part of our memories,, The Martinez family ,,  ;)

Our stay was pleasant and comfortable.  We stayed one night and didn't use the pool or spa.  The bed was a little hard for me but my hubbie liked it well enough.  This hotel is near the airport and everything about it was adequate for us but the service we received in the restaurant and bar was very good, staff was all friendly and helpful.

Summary Heading: A Fabulous Stay at the Atrium!!
Summary: What a wonderful hotel!  Had an amazing stay while there.  Our room overlooked the sparkling pool and cabanas.  This hotel is courtyard style which really adds to the charm.  The beautiful decor of our room was art deco, beds were comfy, comfy and we LOVED our big, flat screen TV (with HBO!).  From beginning to end our stay was amazing!  It's so refreshing to see such an upbeat, knowledgeable, professional staff.  From the front desk to the bell service to the catering and restaurant, the service was stellar.  The Hibiscus Suite, where we had our event, was beautiful!  Perfect for weddings, anniversary parties, all special celebrations and the food was FANTASTIC.  This is an OC GEM for sure.  Thanks to Frederick Pina, Front Office Manager for making our stay and experience so

Summary Heading: Room was decent; Wifi internet very slow
Summary: The main reason to stay at the hotel is because it is a 5 min walk to John Wayne airport terminal.  The room I stayed in had an excellent, comfortable bed, a comfortable chair, decent desk, flat screen TV.  The staff was friendly and courteous.  The bathroom was dated, and perhaps still needed to be renovated, but it worked fine.  The biggest complaint I have is that the Wifi internet connection is dreadfully slow.  Speedtest.net gave me 0.99 Mb/s download, 0.36 Mb/s upload.  This is 3-10 times slower than my cell phone's internet, and 25 times slower than my home internet connection.  The Wifi connection to my computer was strong.  So, be advised, the hotel, staff, and room were good for me, the internet connection was terrible.

This hotel was booked for me by my employer. I was warned that it could be a 'hit or miss' the renovated rooms are ok, but the un renovated ones are really awful (think any hotel room featured in a horror movie). By the rating, you can guess which one I got!  Booking directly through the hotel wasn't an issue since not only did we book through the hotel, multiple rooms were booked.    The hotel was recommended by someone at the place where the conference was held, otherwise I would not have booked this hotel, despite all these negative reviews. The hotel seemed largely empty, so I have no idea why they chose to put me in an un renovated room in a very dingy corner of the hotel.  I have to say the valet service to and from the hotel is nice and the staff is very friendly.  The

looking for a hotel close to oc airport, this was literally right across the street and looks nice from the outside. but reading soom bad reviews, we asked to see a room. they were very nice and showed us two remodeled rooms...pretty nice, not the ritz. he explained that they reserve the new rooms for guests who book directly through them. people who book through a cheaper service get the older rooms. pay the extra 20 bucks or so and get a nice room.  the pool is really cool. they have cabanas everywhere with sofas, the tables and trees light up at night, and there is an poolside small bar. you can lounge on a sofa with a drink and watch the palm trees change color! staff was very nice, we'll be back.

We needed a one night stay hotel by the airport and checked the Atrium out.   Great service right away with the bell hop to the front desk.  Rates are fantastic!  So we thought okay lets try it out.  Went thru the pool area and WOW amazing!!!  Felt like I was at an Oasis with a huge bar, beautiful cabanas surrounding the awesome pool.  4 star quality!  The hotel is older but they did a great job on fixing up the rooms with some modern touches.  The only suggestion for the hotel management  is to invest in new mattresses!  Ours was hard and springs kept springing and when my husband sat on the end of the bed the top of it started flipping upward...eeekss...otherwise service made up for it!!

Stayed here a few times on the way to San Diego.  Great hotel for the price, full restaurant, pool bar.  Our room was nice with a balcony, we did get put in one at first that smelled like it hadnt been occupied in years.  We asked to get switched and it was done easily.  Lighting at night is really cool.  Could use a new smell in the hallways though, smells old and musty.

What an awful hotel. Nothing went right from the moment I arrive.  I'd just travelled for 25hrs and had arranged an early check-in. The room wasn't ready so I had to sit around and wait for over an hour. The last thing I needed after travelling for that long.  When the room was finally ready, I got my door keys and made my way over to the far end of the hotel with my luggage. Got there and the door keys didn't work. Had to go all the way back! Got inside and the room was old and decrepid. The carpet was threadbare, the furniture old and scratched etc etc.  I had URGENT business and needed internet and the phone, neither of which were working. I waited 2 hrs for them to fix the problem. They eventually got the internet on but didn't bother to let me know so I sat there waiting

We booked thru Expedia and got a decent rate. The lobby is beautiful. I want to address the smell that was mentioned in a prior review. It was from the spa and not an unpleasant odor. I found the building to be old, but our room was in excellent condition! The room was extremely clean, carpet in decent shape! We had a view of the courtyard/pool area from our balcony that was beautiful. The pool area with the cabanas was a delightful perk! We spent a lazy day relaxing laying in the shade enjoying the view of the pool area. The breakfast buffet was adequate, nothing special but your basic breakfast. Yes you pay for parking, but had no issues getting into the self park area. I would definitely stay here again! I don't mind older hotels if the rooms are clean! And I have to say ours

We arrived to find a confusing parking set-up.  You can't pull up to the front of the hotel unless you want to do the valet parking.  We had to find the poorly identified parking adjacent to the hotel and carry the kids and bags several hundred feet to the hotel lobby.  The lobby looked nice but smelled terrible.  I can't describe the smell.  It's a stale.....something.  Maybe old carpet that got wet back when Jimmy Carter was the President.   The room had the same odor only more powerful.  The room had very old furnishings.  There was no bathroom door.  There was a "sliding" door with the same hardware that was on a sliding door in my parent's house during the earlier mentioned President's term..  There were several layers of paint on the door making it impossible to slide

The location is great.  The rooms are old and yet clean.  Nothing fancy.  They remind me of our student housing apartment in college.  The bathrooms are simple and also quite old.  The bed was nice with white linens.  The pool area is very nice and towels are provided.  The breakfast provided daily for our family for a small fee was very good--fresh fruit, bacon, eggs, juice, muffins, yogurt.  Parking is $12 per day and not very easy to get in and out.  The kids thought it was great.

I walked out during check in, poor customer service, hidden "$50 per day incidentals" fee taken in full up front and said to be refunded after check out, $12 per day parking, poor parking situation.  Several customers inquired about parking and we instructed to "go and look for parking!"  The lobby area was untidy, hallway where rooms are located had a horrific smell.  The hotel manager did nothing to demonstrate hospitality  to his customers and was very hostile in dealing with unpleased guests.

It may be that because we booked through "Cheap Hotels.com" that the hotel put us in the worst room that I've ever stayed in in the US.  I would compare its quality to ones that I stayed in in Kathmandu, Nepal, a third world country.  Smelled bad, very old TV, very dated decor, etc.  I found out that the hotel was undergoing a renovation and we got the 1954 decor!  After complaining, they moved us to an recently renovated room

Summary Heading: Hotel Atrium at Orange Count Airport UNSAFE, Not Worth It At Any Price
Summary: Too many notes to watch my grammar, so apologies for that and here I go ... Check in at approximately 5:30 p.m. Monday, July 16 - Front Desk Person was in no way welcoming.  Did not give me instructions on how to find my room so I wondered a bit. Find my room, door is stuck.  Try the card key again.  Get the green light again.  Door is stuck.  This is when I should have asked for another room or left all together.  Wish I would have. Put the card in again, get the light, push real hard and pretty much fall into my room.  Door has to be pulled in just a bit to get the main lock to click.  NOT SAFE. Checked out the room, looks like the cleaning people do really try and there is a coffee pot with coffee so feeling better. BUT, then I notice the adjoining door to the room next door

I sayed at this hotel for one night for business.  Usually stay at Embassy suites, or Hilton or Marriott, but could not find a room at the last moment so booked here due to proximity to meeting.  I knew as soon as I walked in the lobby it would not be good.  Lobby smelled - the type of dank, musty odor old motels have.  Room smelled the same - almost seemed like a smoker's room. They tried to update the room (granite counter top in bathroom, new wallpaper) but it just couldn't overcome the outdated hardware, funky sitz type bath tub, old bathroom tile, beat up door.  The room was clean, that's all I can say.

Summary Heading: Might as well go to a Motel 6
Summary: We got an old room in this hotel that  spent their money on the lobby and courtyard.  The bathroom had a pocket door that was very sticky and the paint was worn off.  The bath and sink fixtures were old and scratched with the brass showing through.  The TV was an old, 15" blurry tube type.  The pillows were thin and we had to ask for extras.  The fitness room was just a guest room with the beds removed and had an old stairclimber,  elliptical machine, and a cybex that did two arm exercises.  No towels or water.  Cost was $169 and I had to pay in advance.  After one night we moved to a very nice Marriott nearby that was 1/3 the price.  The staff was courteous and professional.

When checking in the lobby and pool area seemed fine but as we proceeded to our room my heart sank and I said I wish I did not choose this hotel. The front staff were wonderful and the rate was 92.00 for the night, i would have paid double for another place knowing what I know now. I saw a lot of areas in need of work and updating in halls.  Upon entering the room and closing the door the number hand prints and dirt on the back of the door was alarming.  My family was shocked.  The room needs updating.  Would not return here.

Summary Heading: Unless you are exhausted, pass on this hotel!
Summary: I'm sure this hotel was amazing 15 years ago (and I use that time frame because that is what the furnishing seem to reflect) by for the price I paid and the location, I expected WAY more. The paint is chipped off on the bathroom dorr, the furnishings are scrtatched and so old they look like they were gathered from Goodwill! The view is non existent (unless you have a thing for parking lots!) and the "food" came straight from the can.  The pool area is lovely and very typical of many older California hotels. The bartenders were friendly...and that is the only positive I have to say about this place.  There is no access to any of the rooms from the lobby!! I had to walk OUTSIDE the building and take a long hike to get to the elevator (which can only be found by passing through the

I have reviewed this hotel before, I just felt the need to give them one more level up after my last stay. The rooms haven't changed much, but they overall seemed cleaner then the last stay, the reason I am bumping it up is the staff. They seemed much friendlier this time and much more accommodating. SO overall, it's ok for a value hotel near an airport.

So far my stay here is pleasant and the staff is friendly and helpful.  The pool area is definitely an attraction.  I love the huts to enjoy your pool time or lunch.  Stay tuned for my update upon my departure.

I'm trying to figure out why this hotel has been getting low ratings lately. What exactly is the beef? I admit I don't like the self-parking fee that isn't mentioned up front at several travel sites, and that therefore often comes as a surprise. But my experience with the desk staff (we've stayed 3 or 4 times) has always been positive. The pool and pool area are great, as is the lobby. The location is right down the street from several good restaurants (iHOP service sucks, but the food is good). The only legit concern about the accommodations I've experience is that they were dated. However, the hotel is undergoing a renovation and the room we had (3rd floor, pool view) was really nice, and I was told it is representative of the renovated rooms. Overall, our recent stay was

Summary Heading: Not perfect but excellent value for money.
Summary: Chose hotel for 1 night as arrived at OC airport late and wanted a close and cheap hotel when we first arrived. We paid about ¬£70 including breakfast and free wi-fi access. Room was a good size, clean and with a very comfortable bed. Down side was the bathroom which was very small and basic,and sink was outside of the bathroom in a small carpeted area. Buffet breakfast was good. Very pleasant outside area with pool and lots of comfortable covered seating areas.

I attend a recurring conference that has been at The Atrium twice.  The staff is great, the breakfast buffet is consistently good, and any problem I have had has been minor, and handled quickly and to my full satisfaction.  I wouldn't spend a honeymoon here, but as a business hotel, this is a great deal!

I have been coming monthly for a year or so for meetings and I have the highest praise for he staff and the food.  With the rates that we are paying, the staff exemplifies 5 star service!  We have h'oure d'oeuvres served, and again, for the price, they are GIVING AWAY these delicious snacks.  I highly recommend the Atrium Hotel!

Summary Heading: Great Pool Area and Staff / Convenient to SNA Airport BUT QUIET!
Summary: We stayed here because the Atrium is directly across from the Orange Co. (SNA) Airport. Due to the strict flying regulations, we never heard a plane! For sure the early morning and evening hours were quiet. The staff was really great. The room was regular, but had a nice little balcony, and the bed was comfy. All rooms were non-smoking. The tub/shower was interesting. It was square and had a built in seat. Would make a fun place to bathe little ones. The free internet service worked very well. The large pool area was really, really nice. There are huge cabana areas with white lounging couches and pillows for visiting with friends after your swim or just for gathering in the evening. The pool chaise lounges were redwood with lovely cushions.  A couple of restaurants were nearby,

Summary Heading: Needs updating, but service is great!
Summary: This hotel is in desperate need of a facelift: peeling wallpaper, out-of-order "gym" equipment (not a real gym, just a regular hotel room with a few cardio equipment), and lamps that don't work 100% of the time (I had to toggle the plug for it to work). It has a motel feel to the rooms. However, the staff were all very friendly, and the free shuttle that can drive you up to 3 miles radius is a great perk. Not to mention, free wifi! (Free anything is unheard of these days) Good hotel for a short stay, but if you are looking for a 4 star hotel... you might want to look elsewhere!

Summary Heading: Great Service, Great Location, Good Amenities
Summary: I stayed here with a friend for 2 nights to visit family before flying out of the Orange County Airport.  The restaurant food and service and price is very good.  The location is great for flying out of the airport.  The free shuttle to the airport and the mall was also great.  The bartender at the lounge (Patrick) was amazing and made the entire trip so much more fun and enjoyable.  The pool area was also wonderful.  The rooms could use a little updating, but they were very clean and comfortable.  Check-in and Check-out was also very fast and friendly.  I would definitely stay here again if I were staying in the area and would recommend this hotel to others.  It is nothing fancy.  But the service and amenities and food are second to none.  I liked that there was a separate sink

Summary Heading: Great staff - great pool area - poor room quality
Summary: Customer service was very good from the friendly informative shuttle driver to the attentive waiter in the restaurant. This property is minutes to the airport and has an awesome pool area, but the room was below average. The extra blanket I ordered has holes, the wallpaper in the bathroom is peeling off the walls, and there was one bar of soap. The bed is comfortable though and the patio area is roomy. The flat screen TV and free wi-fi is also a plus. So overall I would rate this property as average - glad I didn't pay very much.

staff was stuck up and rude, music is extremely loud and goes very late into the night, the "shuttle service" isn't actually a car service, I was really unimpressed with the room. My room service food had hair in it and was flavorless. I will not be returning here and do not recommend it.

I dont know what I did wrong. The price was nice, as were the pics on the website but my room was dim and the beds were crappy. Misrepresentation? Bait and Switch? TV was small. I tried to ask the desk if they have two styles of rooms for different prices and they put me on hold. (i stayed at a place in Reno that did that: poor rooms for cheap and really nice rooms for a little extra money, like economy vs business class vs first class.. whatever) Staff has to know what I was driving at, but remained evasive. I had a conference so I kinda let it slide. I just wish it was a little nicer.  Been renovated but it retains some very real oldness.

Summary Heading: Close to the airport and convenient
Summary: Very convenient to the airport and friendly staff.  The lobby is upscale, but the rooms are pretty average, though very clean and comfortable.

Summary Heading: A hidden gem (boutique hotel), close to shopping, food, movies
Summary: A hidden gem, but directly across the street from the John Wayne Airport (Orange County). With that said, over the ten days I was there, I NEVER heard an airplane while in my room, the lounge, the lobby or restaurant.  If you're going to rent a car, rent it at Enterprise, off the lobby in the Atrium Hotel. They make amazing deals that the airport location can't, and you'll save significantly on not having to pay the crazy airport taxes and fees. Take the complimentary hotel shuttle (a 2 minute ride) or walk across the street (maybe 10 minutes from the baggage claim to the hotel lobby).  My room was gorgeous, as they're going through a complete overhaul with the rooms. Make sure you inquire about the room that has teh indoor pool. You'll be surprised by the price....and the room

Summary Heading: The water at the bathroom stinks
Summary: Good location...next to John Waynes airport. Close to the IHOP and some more eateries. Dark, shabby room with the tap water stinking. Stayed here for 6 days on business. Front desk staff was unaccomodative...one guy (don't remember his name) was rude and made excuses for not answering my calls...he said he had multiple visitors whenever I called...so, he couldn't answer my calls. Food was average at the Waterfall restaurant with an decent spread. Free shuttle service was available within 5 miles of radius from the hotel. Pool area is good with good music and lighting.

This hotel looks dated in its architecture and its rooms, but that said, they have high end bath amenities, a great pool with cabanas in a center courtyard, and decent happy hour. It is a nice hotel if you need one very close to the airport (its restaurant faces the John Wayne airport parking structure). It's clean and close to the freeway. My room's bathtub was enormous and that was pleasantly unexpected.

This boutique hotel opposite the John Wayne Airport has been a great experience twice now! We chose it initially for the free wireless which was great! We came back this year because of the great breakfast, pleasant wait staff and overall service! It's conveniently located for a yearly visit we make and we will be back again next year!

Summary Heading: Not the best but good for the money
Summary: The rooms are old, outdated, but clean. The tubs are from the 50‚Äôs and not in the best shape.  The really good part of the hotel is the staff for one, food at the restaurant for another, but the nice surprise was the pool area.  The weather was cool and breezy, which made it nice, but the general pool area was Very Cool.  Tents with couches and large pillows made it a great place to congregate in the evening, order drinks and food from the outdoor bar (complete with large screen TVs).  An LED light show in the trees made it feel like a place we once went to in Europe.  It was a fun and relaxing experience.  The hotel is located directly across the street from the Airport, but we never heard a sound.  If the weather is bad and you had to count on the inside rooms to stay, its not

Ok so let me start by saying this hotel has beautiful grounds and pool area. The lobby is also beautiful. However, The beds suck and as hard as rocks. When we booked our rm we told them that there was going to be 3 adults, so they said they would give us the executive suit that sleeps 4...1 king and 1 queen size bed. Great!!! (Knowing we were coming for a family wedding and my uncle's church uses there business rm on a weekly basis.)   Well not so great, we walked in the rm and the bed they called a queen was a hide a bed  fold out with a mattress as thin as a foam mattress with bars...wooohooo REALLY? you call this a bed?? You have go to be kidding me. The only other rm they had available was a double queen rm the size of a studio. That was not going to work for 3 adults. We

Summary Heading: Went years ago and still remember my experience
Summary: I spent the night at the Atrium Hotel the summer of 2005 and still remember the experience.  I was on a work trip during my graduate degree and had spent the long and very hot week in El Centro, CA.  I was young and impressionable but well travelled.  I remember the Atrium Hotel because it smelled good, had very comfortable beds and comforters.  This is the first hotel I remember being "green".  I was greeted in my chilly room with a card asking me to help them conserve water, I remember writing a note saying I would love to but was only staying one night.  Next time I visit CA I will make my way to the Atrium and cross my fingers its as good as I remember.

Summary Heading: Nice place by John Wayne Airport.
Summary: Nice rooms and a lot less noise than most airport hotels.  The breakfast buffet was pretty standard and property was maintained well.  The fitness center was much less than average and very very limited.

Summary Heading: The Atrium Hotel @ Orange County Airport Does It Again :)
Summary: Our stay was fantastic. If you are looking for a hotel with 5 Star service and cheap rates, this is the place to be!!!!! The hook is the beautiful courtyard with double pools and white tented cabana‚Äôs.  We felt transported to a little villa with all the amenities of Orange County at our service. The onsite Rental Car service is a plus***make sure to haggle it will benefit your rate*** They offer free shuttle service around the hotel, the airport is in walking distance, but still out of the range of the flight patterns.  My husband and I were able to relax and enjoy our stay. We will be back!!! Special ‚ÄúThank You‚Äù to Fredrick (The Hotel Service Manager) & to Juana (Room Extraordinaire Attendant)

Summary Heading: Always a great place. Fantastic Cabanas in the pool area.
Summary: We stay at the Atrium every year with our softball team. It is easily located next to the airport. The rooms a great (could upgrade the TV's to flat screens), food was good but the pool area with the cabanas were fantastic. Comfortable couches to lounge in with TV and the wonderful California breeze. Close to Huntington and Newport beaches. Really enjoyed our stay there.

Summary Heading: Horrible Customer Service-Hole in the Wall Room
Summary: I would have to agree with others when they said the outside and the lobby of the hotel are misleading. TERRIBLE Room-my A/C unit went out in the middle of the night and the shower was the size car trunk. Not to mention how incredibly rude the girl was at the front desk. Did not give me continental breakfast coupons like she gave the other couples checking in. Was incredibly rude and full of attitiude and could hardly perform her job function. Terrible place to stay-what a rip off. If it was not for the close location to the airport, I would have never stayed. Never again. RUDE RUDE RUDE

Don't go into the restaurant at 8:40 because they will tell you they are about to close. The bar is friendly but limited seating. Rooms are standard fare but for 119 I guess I can't complain too much. But service on the bar and restaurant is everything.

Summary Heading: Good for cheap overnight trip near airport; fabulous pool area at night
Summary: Hotel has a fabulous atrium area with cool disco lights lighting up the palm trees and pool area with large oversized cabanas with comfy sofas.  It was cool, funky, and fun and magical at night.  However, the rooms are older and in need of remodeling.  The quality of the rooms seemed like how I remember Howard Johnson's from my childhood.  Our room was adequate for a night's sleep, but it was a letdown after the nice lobby and atrium area.  We kind of wished we could go back out to the cabanas at the pool, pull the curtains closed, and sleep on those comfy sofas.  The pool could have been a few degrees warmer.  My daughter tried swimming in it and was too cold.  The price was right, and the atrium area was one of a kind, but next time, we might stay at the larger chain hotel

I completely agree with many of the other reviews, do not be fooled by the lobby or the pool area, which have been remodelled and look really nice. The rooms are not good at all. We got a room where the air conditioning didn't work and the room was extremely dated and the bed old and lumpy. We ended up on the ground floor just outside the pool, I would not recommend that room on a weekend as they have loud music at the pool and we could hear it through our glass sliding doors. I don't think it worth the price they are charging especially since the family we went with was able to get a better price at the Hilton right next door which was much better (late minute trip for us so by the time we booked, the deal was gone). I was disappointed and would not stay there again.

Summary Heading: Don't be fooled by the entrance look; ask to see a room before check-in
Summary: The entrance looks very nice, but it is as nice as it gets.... Don't be fool by grand look at the front entrance;  ask to look at a room before you check in.  You will then agree with all the bad reviews published on this web site.  It looks like the hotel was remodeled from an old nursing home.   The remodel was not complete either; there are still traces of the old structures left behind -- eg. hall way, and doors.   Please stay away from this hotel and find yourself a better place instead.  Even though it is rated 3-star hotel, it is worse than the 2-stars that i have stayed before..

When you walk in the front door and check in, pass through the pool area with it's beautiful cabanas and outdoor bar, on your way to your room it is quite lovely. However....the moment you step into your room you have entered a time warp! A room with peeling wallpaper, outdated huge televisions, peach print wornout, faded bedspreads and drapes, and a worn looking barcalounger that may or may not recline. Just try not to spend time in your room! The pool area is so very nice and the grilled chicken caesar salad is awesome. The manager of the restaurant treats all guests with the utmost courtesy and service. He should be working at a much higher end property with his great customer service skills!

July 21, 1011.. I believe in sharing good and bad.... The good, well the restaurant food except buffet was good. The bad - It took two days to get my shower working (other than a trickle) and they wouldn't move me. The room was shades of the 70's and bathroom counter had stains and cracks. On Thursday they had a private party at the pool and music, sorry LOUD music until past 10 pm. When I went the bar for a glass of wine I was told that the selections of all beverages was minimal that night because all of the beverages were focused on the private party. So room patrons were out of luck. Horrible experience and wouldn't recommend to anyone and the wi-fi only works in lobby.

Throw back to the 70's. Actually, everthing in this hotel appears to be original. The curtains in my room had worn through holes as if eaten by moths and a small to match. You could only use the tub in a featle position. The only current thing about the hotel is the pool area and landscaping. This could be an excellent hotel to stay in worth much more if it was only renovated to at least the '90's. Shame to the owner. I won't be staying here again. The photos are misleading.Oh! And no wireless internet, just a physical cable connection - left over from the late '90's.

Summary Heading: Okay hotel, better choices else where
Summary: The rating/review on tripadvisor is terrible.  Only stayed here because it's booked by the host in Irvine.  After a two-night stay, don't think it's that bad, but may try other hotels in the area next time.   Pros: large room, helpful staff, nice courtyard and pool cons: distance between buildings are too far and elevators are located even further away.

Well, if you had to stay a night, this place might not be so horrible. I stayed here for a week +. And well, I will say they try. but it is just an old hotel with a bad attempt at an update. So here we go. They have obviously redecorated at some point, the bathrooms and all surfaces in the sleeping part are all matching granite, which was nice, but then there is a second sink in with the shower that is still the old yellowed porcelain. Why not change it all? our in wall sliding bathroom door was old and ill fitting to the point where it closed at the top and had a solid inch of opening at the bottom. The ceiling had been patched several times from leaks I assume, but the patch work was shoddy. The beds were very very hard and as others mentioned very outdated. As is the tube

I had a very unpleasant experience at the hotel.  They brag about their complimentary shuttle from the airport to the hotel, however, when we called they forgot to send the shuttle, so we waited over 25 minutes...far too long considering the hotel is less than a mile away.  Someone else who ended up in the shuttle was waiting even longer.  Then the shuttle driver shared with us that had been very busy.  Apparently a hotel guest wanted to be moved to the Radisson down the street so the shuttle took him there.  That should have been my first clue that it was not going to be a great experience.  When we finally arrived it was almost 10 pm and were hungry.  Too bad the restaurant closed at 9.  Room service stops at 9 pm as well.  What hotel does that?  We asked for options and we

Summary Heading: We Loved it and we'll be back!!!!!
Summary: Thank you for your email and the opportunity to tell you what a beautiful hotel you have!!! My grandson and I both loved it!!!  He is only six years old and fell in love with you various water features, especially the waterfall in front!  Everyone was most gracious.  We attended the Irish fair and came back exhausted.  Since we were  both hungry for real food and very dehydrated, we stopped at your restaurant for dinner before retiring.  The food and service was excellent and our water glasses never had a chance to get empty.  Now my grandson wants water with lemon all the time!!!  The dinner options were all wonderful however, we worked the selection down to a grilled cheese with fries and black bean soup for my grandson and the Mongolian beef and french onion soup for myself.

Not the hotel we expected based on their website. Nothing they advertised was true, other than they charge for parking.  The rooms are old and feel unclean, not to mention smelly. There is wifi in the lobby only, not in the rooms. There are no complimentary newspapers, no breakfast, and expect to be charged if you use the business center. The staff is clueless and useless, so if you do have problems they can't offer any help.  The only saving grace for this place is the location. It is close to the airport and the 405. Bottom line -- If you have any other options stay somewhere else!

Summary Heading: You couldnt pay me to stay here
Summary: Myself, my husband and our two small children stayed here a total of one hour. I was so disgusted by the hotel room I had to leave. We only planned on staying one night, as we were leaving Orange County the next day, but I couldnt bear the thought of my kids playing on that carpet or sleeping in those beds. Dont be fooled by their website like I was! The hallway to our room looked as if it had once been a mental asylum, complete with swinging surgery room doors. I'm quite certain that someone has either been killed in that room or hired a prostitute, maybe both. Please do not waste your money or time on this crumbling dilapidated horror show. We went next door to the Hilton and for only $30 more had a very nice, clean room! Oh, did I mention we still paid for our room at the
Manager Response: We want and encourage our guest that stay at the hotel for their comments about their stay with us.  I feel it is important for us to hear both the good and bad, so we can improve our weaknesses as a company.  This is the first time I heard a guest refer to our hallways as something from a mental asylum; however, I never have been in one, so they may be correct.  Since we have started working on our hallways to update them we have had nothing but good comments, so this would be a first for me.  As for the carpet and beds I did not hear any specifics about what the problem was, so I wouldn't know how to address it.  I must take  offense to the reference to someone being killed or a hired prostitute. Once again, I have never been to a crime scene or been in a room that has had a hired prostitute.  We value the comments of our guests and will respond appropriately.

Summary: When I found out were our Annual Meeting was being held I looked at the reviews and I was very concerned, so I contacted our Regional Manager of Production and voiced my concerns over the reviews.  My Regional informed me that she visited the hotel and it may not be for everyone, but it would be perfect for us, so don't judge before I see it for myself.  The employees were great and very helpful and the pool area reminded me of a resort in Miami with the cabanas.  The only negative I would say during my 5 days is that I had a second floor room that was very dated and had 19 inch tv.  I asked the young lady at the front desk if they hand another room, so they moved me to a room on the third floor and what a difference compared to my first room.  One other note, the food in the

Summary Heading: DONT STAY HERE! THEY WILL STEAL YOU BELONGINGS!!!!
Summary: My family and I stayed at this hotel for a week, we had two rooms. Let me tell you that the service is horrible. It's terrifying to be so unprofessional. They don't have any safe deposit boxes. So at anytime you can get things stolen from the room. My parents had $4,500 dollars in a hand bag along with very important documents. Since there was no safe deposit box my parents decided to hide it in the room under the bed. Staying for a whole week our trip was finally over so we decided to head home. After 3 hours my parents remembered hiding the bag under the bed and forgetting in the room we were staying in so, I called the hotel and asked them to check the room to hold our bag that we had forgotten and they said they will get back to us. When I called back to see if they had
Manager Response: I am very familiar with this family and the situation that they are claiming took place at our hotel.  First of all, we do have security deposit boxes at the front desk for our guest.  We first received the complaint on Sunday were my front office supervisor called the housekeeping manager and they both went to the room to check for this bag.  They did not find the bag, so they checked with the housekeeper who cleaned the room and she informed them that there was no bag under the bed, so they checked her cart to make sure that there was no mistake and they did not find anything.  The front office supervisor filed an in-house incident report and contacted me about the situation.  On Monday morning I had several voice mails from this family, so I called the mother back who was the actual guest at our hotel to let her know that I would look into the situation and talk to those involved.  While I was conducting my investigation we had several different family members and relatives coming to the hotel or calling to see why we had not returned any of their calls.  I talked to the mother and told her that I would contact her as soon as I completed my interviews.  The mother's daughter called me and asked what was going on and I informed her that I had talked with her mother and that is who I will continue to talk too once I have conducted everything that I needed to do.  After my completion of the investigation I called the mother and let her know that there was no change from the report of my front office supervisor had made.  The mother accussed my housekeeper of being a thief and told me that I should fire her right away.  I informed the mother that we cannot accuse anyone without facts that they stole the money, or the important documents in the bag that was never found.  At this point we started to receive threats from this family if we don't give them the money that was stolen they would send out emails and blogs to everyone about how bad the hotel and they steal from you.  I informed the mother that she should contact the irving police department about this and file a report.  I was contacted by gentleman who claimed that the family hired his company to send out blogs about the hotel, but he wanted to hear our side of the story before sending anything out.

Summary Heading: Great value for the money and good service.
Summary: Checked in after an exhausting delayed flight from Boston. Everyone that I met during my 2 day stay--from the front desk personnel, to the shuttle driver/valet parker, to the room service personnel to the restaurant staff were professional and courteous. Room was clean, bed comfortable, grounds very well kept. Would definitely stay there again without hesitation---better than a lot of so-called four star hotels I have stayed in.

Summary Heading: I'd rather stay in my car.
Summary: This hotel was absolutely disgusting. From the lack of customer service to the frightening exterior and interior of the room/hallways...I was very unimpressed. My mom, friend and I were visiting some friends near this area and wanted to find a decent hotel to stay in for the night. Our first stop was the Ayres Hotel which looked pretty nice...however, they were sold out. Then from there, they recommened this terrible hotel. When we got there, we thought maybe this would be a decent hotel. Well, we were sadly mistaken. The outside of the hotel is very VERY deceiving. Do not be fooled! My advice? Go into a room before you spend the money. To be completley honest, The hotel itself (including the room) smelled like a nursing home. It was very dingy and our room didnt seem to have
Manager Response: I am very sorry that you had a terrible experience with our hotel during your brief visit.  I appreciate you taking the time to let me know about your visit and all of your concerns.

Summary Heading: Amazing disco lights enliven the pool at night
Summary: Polite staff, reasonably priced restaurant, and across-the-street availability to the SNA Orange County Airport.  But what sticks in my mind is the remarkable pool area, complete with bar, tented couches, and ever-changing colored mood lighting on the palm trees around the pool. That is unusual, and visually compelling.

Summary Heading: Great Price, Good room, Best Value
Summary: BLUF:  I would gladly stay at the Atrium Hotel again.  I received a good value for the money!   (BLUF means Bottom Line Up Front)  In late August, 2010 I booked 14 rooms for our daughter‚Äôs wedding in Newport Beach.  Before I made the reservations I went on Trip Advisor and read the reviews.  I saw reviews from both sides of the spectrum, so I was concerned to say the least.   We booked our reservations through the group sales staff and I expressed my concerns to them before booking the rooms.  They were honest and worked hard to address my concern and to make our stay a pleasant one.  Were things perfect? No.  Did our concerns get addressed and were we happy?  Yes.  All of my family and friends who stayed said they were very happy with the service and amenities we received.  The

Summary Heading: DON‚ÄùT STAY HERE SPEED A FEW MORE DOLLARS AND STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!
Summary: The Best Part of the Atrium Hotel is Leaving It! this review is on the money.... We stayed for 5 days and forget about hospitality.... there is none. When we book the room we were not advised that the pool would be closed the everyday due to private parties ...never got near the pool always closed! The Front desk personnel (except Brittany) should find new jobs as they don‚Äôt understand the meaning of hospitality...The facility is old , worn out andthe lights were not working in our room. Two of the days the maid left the bedding undone (the bedding was behind a chair) When we asked for extra towels we were advise to call the front desk etc, etc, etc. DON‚ÄùT STAY HERE SPEED A FEW MORE DOLLARS AND STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!
Manager Response: I would like to apologize to this guest, because he is right about us having two pool side events during his stay.  On that Friday the pool closed down at 3pm until 11pm and on Saturday the pool was closed all day.  We did make accomodations for our guest to use the pool next door at the Hilton; however, that does not justify you not being able to use our pool for your stay.  Our lack of service is another issue that is unexceptable to us and I am sorry that you had to experience that during your stay.   We are currently working on the condition of our hotel, but with the current economic conditions that we are in it has slowed down the process.  One of the processes that we have initiated at the hotel in moving forward on going Green is to ask our guest if they are staying over three days if they need their room cleaned every day or could we do it every other day to help the environment.  I am very sorry for your stay and the lack of communication on our part that could of made your stay a pleasant one.

Summary Heading: The Best Part of the Atrium Hotel is Leaving It!
Summary: I attended a music event at this hotel recently and was appalled at its poor hospitality, prices charged customers and treating customers like criminals.    While trying to relax by the pool area, hotel employees were constantly inspecting guest‚Äôs drinks to make sure that no one brought their own beverage into the pool.  They wanted to ensure that people could only purchase their beverages at $6.50 for domestic beer and $8.50 for a well drink.  Due to their constant harassment, I gave up trying to enjoy the one amenity that the hotel does offer.   Several people who also attended the event were booked into substandard rooms (i.e. furniture missing, no countertops, etc.).  Forget about having a mini refrigerator their 24 oz water was priced at $5.00.  Talk about price gouging.
Manager Response: I appreciate you giving me your opinion of your event and I will make sure that I forward it to our Director of Catering and the person who was in charge of putting the event together, so we can find out what happened.  There are some points that I would like to clarify regarding the property and the event itself.  The event organizer put out a email to all attendees on 8-25-10 that gave the details on the food and pricing that was picked by the organization and the special drink pricing.  They also stated in the email that attendees were not allowed to bring their own beverages, bottles or pool chairs to the pool area.  As a business we can not allow glass around our pool area for the safety of all our guest.  We are not allowed to have guest bring their own liquor or alcoholic beverages into our public area's, because that is against California State Law.  You are right about the pricing for a domestic beer, but our well drink pricing was $6.50 unless you ordered a call or premium brand for your drink.  As for the substandard rooms that you mentioned, there are no rooms in our hotel that do not have all the furniture or countertops.  The $5.00 water in the room is not 24oz, it is the FIJI 1 Liter for $5.00 in every room.  When other guest in the hotel start complaining about another room making a lot of noise at that time of the evening we do let them know that they need to quiet down, because of the complaints.  If they do not comply then we ask everyone to leave who is not a registered guest of that room.  Our restaurant hours for this event was until 11pm each night except on Saturday night when we stayed open until 12am.  The restaurant seats 75 people and we had over 500 guest in the hotel, so we made the decision to have a full breakfast buffet for everyone and not do a order off the menu that way everyone would be able to get in and eat in a reasonable time frame.  We had eggs, sausage, bacon, assorted cut up fruit, assorted cereals, assorted danishes and bread for toast and orange juice.  Irvine Police Department showed up, because the Hilton Hotel next door complained about the noise of the bands.  They wanted us to shut it down; however, we were able to convince them to continue if we would control the volume.

Summary Heading: Convenient Location to Airport & Fabulous Private Pool & Cabanas.
Summary: Before traveling to California I spent time on trip advisor looking over the reviews. I was quite concerned about the hotel that  was selected by the travel coordinator for a business week long conference. My wife who was joining me on the trip was prepared with a Marriott  hotel backup just in case The Atrium turned out to be dirtly, awful and just plain lousy. To our pleasant surprise, The Atrium was just fine. The rooms were clean, newly remodeled/updated and the pool/bar in the courtyard was simply splendid. The cabanas are better then their pictures and the pool was very clean and well maintained. The lobby and restaurants were spacious and clean. The front desk staff and ground maintenance were friendly, attentive and willing to accommodate our every need. The food in the

Summary Heading: Old, Worn, Dirty and Broken. Need I say more?
Summary: I travel a lot on business to SoCal and needed a place near Newport Beach and within the client's budget (under $100/night). At this time of year, all the crumb crunchers going to Disneyland drive up the O.C. fares and hotel prices big time. But here was this seemingly great hotel, The Atrium, a block from my meeting and so cheap. So I did some research on this site to see what others had to say.  The reviews were very negative. Few had good things to say. But did I listen and heed my fellow traveler's advice? No. So I booked it and figured "How bad could it be?".  Well, it's pretty awful. The lobby and restaurant are OK. The parking worked out fine. But the rooms and other areas of the hotel are disgusting. Old, worn, dirty and broken pretty much describes this hotel. The rooms
Manager Response: I wanted to tell you how much I appreciate you taking the time to do this review.  I apologize that we did not meet your standards, but I thought you might like to know what we are doing to address your comments.  Currently we are in the process of re-doing our hallways throughout the hotel.  We are also working internally on painting the guest rooms and getting rid of that 80's peach and pastel colors.  Our engineering team is continuously replacing plumbing fixtures and will continue to do so until we have replaced all the fixtures.  Our A/C units are brand new in all the rooms and we are trying to work out all the kinks.  We are also in the process of replacing all of our tv's.  Currently we have been able to replace 1/3 of the tv's in our rooms.  As for the carpet, this is the first time I have heard something like that, so I talked to the housekeeping staff to make sure that we are not cutting any corner's when it comes to the cleanliness of our rooms.  The rooms might not be as updated as you would like, but we do expect for the room to be clean.  Our hotel is a non-smoking hotel, so if your room smelled like old cigarettes then we should have done a better job of making sure it was ready to be occupied without the smell.

Summary Heading: You may not have a room!
Summary: We recently stayed at this hotel while in the area for a softball tournament. we had reserved a room for 3 people ( King bed with a roll away). Upon arriving at the hotel, we were advised by the night manager that she only had a room available for us with a double bed and there were no roll away's available. When we told her that we had reserved something different she informed us that we  had a reservation but that is was  onlya request for  a king bed and a roll away. We asked her where we were going sleep and she informed us that it was our problem and needed to figure it out ourselves.
Manager Response: I apologize that you did not receive your king bed with a roll away.  Our focus is to be more proactive, so I believe the front office agent seen you were in a king with 3 people and wanted to make your stay more comfortable.  She made a decision to put you into a room that had two beds instead of one king and a roll away "which are smaller than a bed".  We don't have a night manager that is female, so if you have a name or more information to provide to us that would be greatly appreciated.  This is very important to me, so I can have a conversation with this individual on the importance of how we communicate to our guest.

Summary: The hotel rooms don't look like their pictures.  Rooms were poor.  When we checked in, someone had already used the toilet.  The screen door to the "patio" was broken.  We were also charged $50 for the "reservation hold" when we checked OUT!  We were also charged TWICE for breakfast.  They said (on the phone) that that was normal for them to put the reservation hold on the credit card.  I don't understand why they would do that on check-out.  Reservation holds are for when someone doesn't show up!  WTH????  After calling the hotel they said the charges would be taken off our credit card in 3-7 days.  Either they are floating our money or something fishy is going on.  The only great thing about the hotel was the bell hops.  I wouldn't go back there even if someone else paid for
Manager Response: I would like to apologize for your terrible stay with our hotel.  There is no excuse to be checked into a dirty room.  I went up and checked the screen door on the balcony to see if it was broken, but it was working very nicely.  What might of happened is that it was locked and the guest did not know this and thought that it was broken.  The $50 dollar charge is for incidental charges, not a reservation hold.  This fee is authorized at check-in and released as soon as the guest checks out.  It"s the individual's bank who authorizes the release of the incidental charges, not the hotel.   As for being charged twice for breakfast, if it wasn't taken care of before you checked out, please give me a call and I will look into it and make any necessary adjustments.

Summary Heading: Go for it if the price is low
Summary: We stayed a weekend at the Atrium. My wife and I had spent nights here over 10 years ago. This hotel is good only if you can get a room for under $80 like I did. I know some people who have spent over $120 per night and I feel sorry for them. The hotel's service is bad especially the front desk. Only one person is usually there checking guests in, answering phones, addressing complaints, etc. The rooms are OK but check to make sure that they are not holding a special event by the pool because it can get very loud, especially if they have parties with music.  Getting into the hotel from the parking lot was also a hassle. We couldn't get in using our hotel key card. We later found out that all the doors are locked from one side of the building. A sign saying you can't enter would

I stay in over 75 different hotels a year all over the planet. This hotel is one of the best. Its nice new quite, the staff bends over backwards for me. The food is not normal hotel grub. I would go to the eat here even if I were not a guest. Great location. Its a older property but been totally remolded. The beds can not be beat. I am as picky as it gets and this place makes me feel at home. I have stayed at all the big chains and the Atrium is the best.

Summary Heading: Excellent Value; clean, basic rooms, very attractive lobby, dining, and beautiful courtyard with pool
Summary: My extended family and I stayed in 2 & 3 rooms for a total of 11 days, using the hotel as a base and checking in and out for over 2 weeks as we took car trips to nearby places like Vegas . Excellent-priced rooms (via Orbitz), facing the parking lot  and at times facing the courtyard pool, were mostly quiet--maybe a bit of hallway noise but not a problem. No noise from nearby airport ! Toilets tended to flush loudly but did not bother any of us.   The Lobby, dining area, and Courtyard with pool were very attractive leading Granny to say she felt as though she were in her nice villa home.        On my last night, there was a problem with phones ringing every 30 min.starting @ 3 a.m. in all rooms until we unplugged them at 4:30 a.m.. Hotel staff said they were working on it.  Maybe

I travel alot and stay in a lot of hotels. This hotel was by far the worst hotel ever. The pictures on their site are a joke.
