I asked the front desk person about the photos and she said those were pictures taken of rooms they will have some day. There are two of those rooms. The room we had smelled. The deadbolt didn't work. They have poured money into the pool area but forgot about where people actually sleep. My pillow had a person's name written on it and the sheets were inside out. I am guessing they flipped the sheets instead of changing them. IT was a terrible experience. WORST EVER!

Summary Heading: Right Place, Right Price, Great Value
Summary: The hotel is directly across the road from the OC Airport which is why I selected it as I had a flight first thing in the morning.  Check in was easy and the clerks were very nice.  I had to leave the lobby, cross through the pool area (which is high-end nice) to get to my room.  The hallways are a little plain and worn, and the room is also very plain, but clean and met all expectations.  I was working all night so I ordered room service and here is the best surprise I have had traveling in years.  The food was superb, the prices were fair, delivery charges were small, and the server himself was attentive and friendly.  WOW!  I was in a snaking sort of mood so I had the Thai Calamari, Sweet Potato Fries an Chicken soup.  All items were hot, the fries, crispy and serving sizes

Summary Heading: Beautiful courtyard, a block from airport, no wireless in room
Summary: More great things, few drawbacks, loved the stay overall. Fast check-in. Our room (#374) was a no-smoking but the bathroom reeked of cigarretes. Next day they switched us to another room (#382) and it was fine. Those two rooms overlook the pool area - great view from balcony. There's no wireless in either room, only wired. What I loved the most: the great courtyard & pool area with heated cabanas - no one was hanging around; heated swimming pool - again in December we were the only crazy folks to venture.   You can walk to a few good places from the hotel - a food court on Michelson, a bar called Bistango that has the most amazing lamp chops apetizers for $5 at the bar (5pm to 9pm). The hotel restaurant has good food as well - very delicious pizza and fish.  Overall, get a room

Summary Heading: You're Better Off Sleeping at the Airport
Summary: When I first entered the Atrium's lobby, I was greeted by blaring Christmas music and an overwhelming fake pine smell. That was preferable, though, to my room. The decor was combination of 70s porn flick and 80s Golden Girls set. There was a stale, musty smell, a rattle from the heating system, and what could only be a blood stain on the floor. The room was small, old, and tired. But it was 12:30 Pacific time (3:30 a.m. my time), so I just went to bed.  We had a meeting there, and the meeting room was nothing more than a hotel room without the furniture, including the bathroom with a pocket door that would not shut all the way. Needless to say, my colleagues and I had to trek to our rooms to use the restrooms.  Other "highlights":  -The shuttle is first-come, first-served, so

If you're needing a place close to the airport, Atrium is VERY close -- easy walking distance.  (one block over)  Atrium provides free shuttle to take you anywhere within 3 miles -- courteous and quick, even on short notice.  (Thank you gentlemen.)  Fountain & inner pool area a bit disney-esque... yet for me, pleasant.  Room very clean; bed comfortable (if firm), though the ratty chairs (esp at the desk) were worn and not comfortable.  Color scheme ok for me.  Ask for a room facing the pool; mine faced boring parking lot.  Because it's so close to the airport, you won't be able to turn in early with window open -- at times intense flight noise.  Encountered rather steady water running niose...  and "sounds" from room above were... noticeable.  Breakfast buffet is basic, if you

I stayed at this hotel for one night in transit for an early flight out of orange county in the morning. The room was nice and spacious, and the pool area was very nice. the decor was impressive. the hotel shuttle was very nice, and even took us to a restaurant in the area and brought us home after, for free. I absentmindedly left my laptop powercord in the room, and I was doubtful as to weather I would see it again, but sure enough it was mailed to me in hawaii. overall I would definitely recommend this hotel for people flying out of john wayne airport, or even just for a nice place to stay in the newport area.

Summary Heading: hotel smells of stale cigarettes and rooms were furnished from the salvation army
Summary: We stayed here on our way to Europe.  The outside and foyer are deceiving....they look okay. The clerks are very unhelpful and don't know anything about directions to area restaurants.....hello!!!!!!  The inside of the hotel and rooms stink of stale cigarettes....it is a non smoking hotel. The room was furnished in brown, orange and yellow furniture from the salvation army. The rocker was so dirty I wouldn't put my suitcase on it. The plugs in the wall  didn't work (or came out) when you unplugged an appliance or computer. The people downstairs were having a disagreement....their friends came in to their room over the outside wall and the noise got worse. I called the desk 3 times....the clerks couldn't find the noise. I told them where  it was, they did nothing. Finally at

Hotel lost reservation because I had made it online and the hotel computer is not connected to the internet. Took me 1/2 hour to finally check-in! Also, my credit card was incorrectly charged with expenses I never incurred. Very unprofessional and slow service!!

Summary Heading: The rooms had a musty, wet smell.
Summary: My husband found this hotel last minute on Expedia, for a weekend trip to Newport Beach. Check in was slow due to a wedding and business event. When we got to the counter, they could not find our reservation, so they just put us in manually. The hotel was very nice on the outside. It looked remodeled, and the pool area with the cabanas looked good. Right when we got into our room, it smelled. It was like a damp, musty, old smell. I thought maybe they had just shampooed the carpets, they felt damp. I called the front desk to request a new room, and the receptionist told me she would call me back in 5-10 minutes. After 15, I called her, and she asked for more time. After another 15 minutes, I walked to the front desk. There was no one checking in, and the two ladies were smilng
The room keys did not work four times and the front desk person called us "clowns".  I recommend not staying on the propery.

They have made some changes since the last time I stayed there over 2 years ago.  The pool area is amazing and the service was the best I have ever had at the hotel.  My room was average, but one of the girls at the front desk showed me some of the new rooms they are doing and she promised to make sure I got one of the new rooms next time I'm at the hotel.

The hotel has a very tropical feeling to it.  I think the rooms and hallways are a bit dated and could be more modernized.  That being said the interaction with the hotel staff was a wonderful experience.  I hope my company uses this hotel more often for meetings, because we sure did enjoy the poolside cabanas for our reception.

The main drawback with TripAdvisor reviews is that different travellers have different expectations and sometimes an excellent rating for a basic motel is higher than a mediocre one for a luxury hotel, and can mislead as to what one is getting for the money.  The Atrium is superior to most chain motels (it may once have been one itself) and unless you demand a free breakfast or free parking you may get with it something close to a luxury hotel at a convenient location, perhaps for a bargain price.  	My wife and I just stayed at the Atrium at John Wayne Airport for two nights as the result of a ‚Äú$53. (plus tax) per night for 2 nights‚Äù offer we got from Hotwire. I have read the reviews on Trip Advisor after the blind purchase was made so I was interested to learn what we would

Summary Heading: Don't be fooled by the first impression
Summary: It is hard to beat the location of this hotel if you are flying from John Wayne airport. We did not have reservations. My husband was tired and did not want to look for anything else, since the price was resonable ($89) and everything looked decent. We were flying back home to SC next morning and he wanted to return the rental car that night in order not to rush in the morning. He just walked across the street after he returned the car and we did not have to pay for overnight parking. But that is about all the advantages of this hotel. The rooms looked shabby and old. The sheets were yellowish and thin. It was noisy and we woke up much earlier than we had to because of the constant noise from water running through the pipes or people walking above us. Hotel lobby and the pool

We ended up in this hotel as we were meeting clients who recommended it. I am actually writing this review sitting in the hotel. At $189 a night it is TERRIBLE. Actually at any price it is terrible. Noisy, smely, outdated and hot. The rooms are dark and stale. The air conditioner is non existing. The noise form the upstairs rooms are awful. There is absolutly no reason to stay here.

We checked into the Atrium for several nights during the hottest part of the year so far in the O.C. We'd stayed at this hotel before during cooler weather so temperature wasn't an issue. We were sorely disappointed by this time around.  The hotel itself is a nice, remodeled facility which tries to make itself look like a hipster hangout. I won't go so far as to say I saw any real hipsters there, but it gets a few points for trying. Strolling the property itself feels like a balance of walking between some want-to-be cool hotel and a remodeled motel from the 60s.  The room itself was remodeled, which was nice. Here's where things went downhill though - the "AC" advertised by the hotel is in fact not in-room AC but something completely different. Our particular room had a wall

Summary Heading: Tremendous Value but don't expect a Hyatt
Summary: I stayed here for an onsite seminar. If I had known there was a Hilton right next door, I might have chosen to stay there, but not having been to OC for over 10 years, I played it safe and stayed at the Atrium. While the stay wasn't perfect, it was definitely acceptable. The rate was only $119, which by San Francisco standards is *really* inexpensive for the level of amenities provided.  The good - you can walk (about 2.5 blocks total distance) from the airport, through the garage, to the hotel. There is also a free shuttle that you can pick up in the Ground Transportation Center that comes in about 10 minutes. On Sunday, the shuttle took me to the from the South Coast Plaza shopping center. I had to wait 15 on  my return trip. If you get unlucky and the shuttle has just left

Summary Heading: Not all good, not all bad
Summary: I stayed here this past week (end of 3/08) as it was the 'recommended' hotel for a conference I was attending at UCI.   There are definitely pros AND cons. The pros first: 1. Location across from the airport couldn't be easier. And only a 7 min. drive to UC Irvine. 2. My room was very clean w/enough towels and other amenities. 3. Lobby and pool area are impressively clean and staff is very polite. 4. I was entitled (don't know how) to free breakfast buffet and free parking for the duration. The breakfast buffet offers hot entrees and the usual cereal and pastries. It's good and well stocked if not terribly exciting. Totally fine for me. 5. Despite the location, I never heard any airport noise in my room with the window closed. It does get 'stale' air that way though.

I have read the reviews and I still chose to brave the atrium hotel. I had friends staying there for a convention so I chose to check out this hotel with such a rotten rep here on trip advisor. The first day I could not figure out what everyone was complaining about. Check in was easy and the staff were great. Their credit card machine was down, but the staff was very friendly. The customer service at this point was textbook as they explained the issue and how they would resolve it. The bed was comfortable; the room was clean and quiet. Sure there were a few things‚Ä¶ There were only 2 towels and one washcloth, no sugar/creamer with the coffee and my patio chairs were missing. But all and all I liked the room. The pool area was beautiful. There was a wedding during our visit and

Summary Heading: It's not terrible, but it's not great.
Summary: I stayed here on 3/3 - 3/4/08 for a seminar on site. I booked directly from their website, about 2 weeks in advance. It's very easy to find, and directly across from the airport.  When I pulled up in front the valets were very friendly and advised me of the 2 options, valet($14) or self parking($10). I chose self parking and he still offered to carry any luggage I might have.  Check in was fast and easy, the desk staff extremely friendly. The lobby is remodeled and looks really nice. I was given my keycard and a map of the motel layout with my room circled for me. The room also included a free breakfast buffet.  I was on the 3rd floor (3 is as high as it goes) overlooking the pool area. Getting to my room was a bit of a drag as there are two buildings that are connected by an

Summary Heading: Like sleeping in a nightclub from hell!
Summary: After taking a client and kids from out of town to Disneyland for 14 hours we arrived exhausted to the hotel ready to drop.  We were horrified to find that just outside our sliding door the hotel had changed the pool area into a hip-hop nightclub, complete with DJ yelling over a microphone and ridiculously loud rap music.  The patrons were dancing, yelling, and screaming and the base was thumping so loud we could feel it in our chest while lying in bed.  At 11:30 I went to the desk to ask when it would end and was informed that it would continue until 2:00 AM.  We had to be up at 5:30 and we were told that we had been informed because there was a flyer left on the desk so we could have checked out.  When I tried to return to my room after going to the lobby to complain the

Pros: Great location across the street from John Wayne Airport.  Cool 2 person showers. Cons: Old and smelly.  Parking is annoying. The Atrium is but outdated in its decor, but I found it clean and fairly comfortable.  I had a non-smoking room, but it must have been a smoking room at some point because the static items, like drapes and furniture, reaked of old cigarette.  I was a bit concerned as the lock on my patio door did not work.  Fortunately, I was on the third floor, so I let it slide.  The walls are indeed paper thin.  I could hear the person in the next room taking a leak every morning they're that thin.  And there was always the pleasant sound of the maids yelling down the hall at 6:30am.  The hotel gym is closed, but they do offer you free passes to the local gym.

Summary Heading: OK for the low-maintenance business traveler
Summary: On the plus side, this hotel has spent money and energy on the pool area and other common areas.  The pool area with bar, cabanas, lots of palms, happy hours and terrific lighting is right out of the Las Vegas-Rat Pack era.  I thought they did a great job with it.  Also positive: every staff member I encountered was friendly and helpful.  However, everything in my room, where I actually spent several hours at a time, was at least 15 years old and needed a complete refurb, including the bathroom and surrounding hallways. The mattress was cheap and uncomfortable (ditto pillows) and the A/C situation is so antiquated it doesn't actually blow air- allegedly you turn the thermostat to your preferred temperature, make sure the slider to your balcony is closed, and you should reach the

Our family stayed at the Atrium Hotel  this past July. Our stay was free due to my husbands' company had a conference there. If I had to pay for my stay, I would have been a bit  disappointed but because it was free; I tried to look for the positive attributes. First, the grounds in my opinion, took me back to a  hotel that I stayed in on a  vacation that  I spent in Hawaii with my parents in 1969. The lobby had a decor of neutral colors, (mostly beiges and browns) with lots of hanging plants and a waterfall fountain. The pool area was acceptable with a bar with high cocktail tables and stools to sit on and several cabanas with cushioned chaise lounges which were in pretty good shape.  It was landscaped with tropical plants and piped in music that reminded me of a forty year old

I haven't felt so cheated in a long time when I first entered the double bed room at the Atrium.  Smelly, small, and awfully resembling an old motel room from the 70's... and to have an extra charge for both parking and Internet?  Crazy.   Why pay so much for a room that looks and smells like a one star establishment when you can get a modern room with all the amenities, breakfast and Hi speed internet at the Courtyard by Marriott?!  Hotels.com were nice enough to quickly cancel my stay with the Atrium and find me a fantastic deal with the Marriott.  If you're looking for a "blast from the past" the Atrium awaits!

Summary Heading: The service is top notch, but the room is down a few notches
Summary: I had to stay here for business purposes. This is one of those hotels where the service is first class but alas, the rooms are not. My suggestion is stay here if you are occupied elsewhere during the day and the room acts as nothing more than a bed and bathroom. If you stay here with the intention of the hotel room and the grounds being part of your vacation, you may want to look into other hotels first.    The service: In a word-terrific. The staff, from the registration desk to the restaurant to the maintenance, was wonderful. They were polite and classy. When I dealt with them, I felt like it was the Ritz.    The room: In a word, motel-like. Clean but two adults will find it cramped. There is an iron at least, no blow dryer. No refrig. Small tv. Coffee machine is in the room.

My mother was in town for work and decided to stay the night so we could spend time together.  Most of the OC hotels were sold out -- it's convention season!  Working in the hospitality field, as a Guest at this hotel, I was extremely disappointed.  The Atrium needs an extreme "facelift." You get what you pay for. The Atrium is not the Ritz...Marriott, or even a Hilton, Its a non-chain hotel. its funny that so many people on here try to compare it to chain hotels, If you want to pay $200.00 and up for a room at the Ritz, go ahead....Ive been staying (along with company colleagues) at the Atrium for over 5 years, They have always treated us all well, the rooms have been clean, the people are great, the restaurant is convenient and food is good, the bar by the pool area is a great place to relax after work, they used to have a great dance club, but I understand its closed now. All-in all, I think, its well worth the price.

I stayed at the Atrium October 2nd for one night while down in Orange County for work from LA. This property may have been a nice place in the 60s, but it is way overdue for a facelift. I booked in advance and was told a king/queen room would be no problem. Wrong. Got stuck with two full-sized beds. I'm 6'3" tall, so this was not good. Was given a room by the elevator, which has a "ding" to it every time someone uses it. Kept me up all night. The walls seemed to be no thicker than paper - could here everything next door and outside. At check-out, wasn't even asked if I enjoyed my stay. Parking is $10 for self-park...why I don't know. Room was dingy and shampoos/soap were the worst quality I've ever experienced in my life. I travel a lot for work and usually stay at Mariott

I booked a room 3 weeks in advance of my stay on the Atrium website.  I received an email confirmation with a confirmation number.  When I arrived I was told they had no record whatsoever of either mine or my business collegue's reservations.  They were sold out and told me to hit the street.  No effort on their part to compensate me for the lack of ability to do business on their part.  No response to my showing them my email confirmation.  This hotel is highly unrecommended.   I recommend taking your business to a hotel that can accept and honor a reservation.

Summary Heading: You maybe able to find better
Summary: I stayed at the Atrium for 3 nights for a business trip.  The room was average...nothing special.  The main problems I had with the room were:  -thermostat was not working -toilet was super loud and took two flushes about 98% of time (but not because of me) -a lightbulb in lamp burnt out.  If your looking for a hotel to get restful nights (unless you are a HEAVY sleeper), this hotel would not be the greatest because of its location.  Being located right across the street from the airport, I had 3 restless nights because of the air traffic noise.  Customer service at front desk was satisfactory.  The on-demand shuttle service as well as the room service was the highlight of my stay.

I have stayed at this hotel 4 times now and have been very satisfied each time.  They have been doing a lot of remodeling and that was about the only thing that I didn't like.  However, I assume it is finished now and the remodeling should make it an even nicer place to stay.  The staff is nice (usually a little overtasked though) and the courtyard has a nice garden atmosphere.  The pool is great and the small, but well maintained, fitness room is a huge plus for me.
